About the Game



THE NEW FANTASY ACTION RPG.
Rise, Tarnished, and be guided by grace to brandish the power of the Elden Ring and become an Elden Lord in the Lands Between.

• A Vast World Full of Excitement

A vast world where open fields with a variety of situations and huge dungeons with complex and three-dimensional designs are seamlessly connected. As you explore, the joy of discovering unknown and overwhelming threats await you, leading to a high sense of accomplishment.

• Create your Own Character

In addition to customizing the appearance of your character, you can freely combine the weapons, armor, and magic that you equip. You can develop your character according to your play style, such as increasing your muscle strength to become a strong warrior, or mastering magic.

• An Epic Drama Born from a Myth

A multilayered story told in fragments. An epic drama in which the various thoughts of the characters intersect in the Lands Between.

• Unique Online Play that Loosely Connects You to Others

In addition to multiplayer, where you can directly connect with other players and travel together, the game supports a unique asynchronous online element that allows you to feel the presence of others.

applist.name: Gunfire Reborn
applist.detailed_description:
About This Game:

  • Gunfire Reborn is an adventure level-based game featuring FPS, roguelite, and RPG elements. Players can control unique heroes—each with different abilities—as they adventure through procedurally-generated levels and pick up randomly-dropped weapons. You can play Gunfire Reborn alone or cooperatively with up to three other players (4-player co-op).
  • Every level is random; each new restart is a brand-new experience. You will meet different heroes and experience new weapons, items, checkpoints, and unique combat rhythms throughout the game.

    Game Features:


    • FPS+Roguelite+RPG combined gameplay, construct diverse Build through death cycle for different experience


    • Elaborate, yet randomized stage experience


    • Over 100 different items and various weapons


    • Many heroes and multiple game plus with different game mechanism


    • Unique art style


    • Co-op level-based adventure

reviews.review:
TLDR down below.

Best shooter roguelike out there.

Has everything a modern roguelike should have: 

- Multiple characters that feel unique:
 Every character has multiple styles of play. You can focus on one of their 2 special abilities or on abilities that improve your weapons. But this is not required, you can use a bit of all 3 styles and still feel strong. Most characters gravitate to certain kinds of weapons with which they will probably do best. All characters have 3 trees of 6 power ups that you can pick from after you finish a stage.

- a lot of different weapons to get:
There are over 50 weapons divided into 8 classes. Most weapons feel unique and have their own gimmick. You can carry up to 2 weapons making certain combo's is possible. A downside with such a big selection is of course that some weapons feel like weaker versions of others. Also each weapon being pretty unique means that some will not be suited to your style at all. 

- Permanent upgrades:
There is permanent progression between runs you can upgrade with a currency you get by playing. I know this goes against the definition of roguelike but all modern rogues have this feature. The devs can make harder/more fun encounters that feel unfair but get less unfair the more you invest in this system which ultimately makes the game better since they can push the boundaries the game. You can also go for an extra challenge by not/ partially investing in this to make it harder for yourself.

- Difficulty settings:

There are 4 difficulties to play in. You are locked to normal at the start but unlock higher difficulties by beating the hardest difficulty you currently have. The 4th difficulty is the most unique, it features unique upgrades you can buy with the same currency used for the permanent upgrades (this means that currency is not useless when you unlocked the whole prema upgrades tree which is nice) which will change the way you play in a major way and is so much fun! The game never feels to unfair, you can win the game with any combination of weapons/power ups as long as you can keep dodging!

- Many upgrades
During the run you encounter these power ups called occult scrolls, they can straight up boost your damage/survivability or change the way you play. Some boost you in a big way but will also restrict you in a way, there is a lot of different 'builds' you can aim to go for.

- 4 worlds to go through, with their own enemies to fight.
The enemies are cool, there is ranged and melee enemies. Some have unique mechanics that are not super hard to play around. Of course this gets harder when it's accompanied by other enemies. Enemies get harder in the later worlds, it's not uncommon to almost get oneshot there. The bosses of these areas are also very good. Huge monsters in their own arena with alot of different attacks that have to be dealt with, and somewhere in between you are supposed to actually kill them.

- Active devs
The game still gets regular patches and updates, there is still a roadmap for their future content like in the beta. They have added new characters, bosses, a new world and a new game mode since beta. There is still more to come as well. When you encounter bugs in game there is a feedback option which you can access during your run and explain the bug. And you actually get listened to, every bug I have reported over the years has been fixed in a reasonable time frame, almost always in the next patch.

- Good pricing
This game is 100% worth getting at full price. It is more then reasonable if you see the huge amount of content here that puts AAA games to shame. There has been 1 DLC so far which included 2 characters. So far it is the only content that is gated behind a DLC, their new game mode that could have been a DLC in itself was added completely free. If you are looking for a game like this I would just buy it now!

- Multiplayer
The game supports multiplayer, there is a matchmaker to play with random people as well. I cannot comment on the quality of that since I never did that. I have only played multi with 1 friend and it was fun, every player gets their own weapon and scroll drops so nobody can 'steal' your upgrades like in Risk of Rain 2. If you don't need your drops you can press a button to make them visible for your allies so they can pick it up. You can help each other get to their preffered build faster but you can't get 'griefed' by people that steal your drops. I feel this is the best way to create a multiplayer experience in a co-op game. The new game mode can also be played with friends. 

TLDR:
if you like this genre, you should definitely buy this. Big worlds, al lot of characters, weapons and power ups. Different difficulties for everyone, a multiplayer that is done extremely well for a co-op game. The devs should feel very proud of what they accomplished with this game. I look forward to the bright future of this game!

The game has this big "one more run" feel that every good roguelike should have.

If I have to put a number on it it's a 9,5/10 for me. I hope this review helped any people with doubts to make a good decision!

Great core gameplay loop with tons of replayabilitiy. Devs stick to their roadmap and deliver on time with reasonably priced dlcs for extra characters + weapons

Meh, I want to like this game more but it's got a lot of problems for me personally. It's not bad, I enjoy it and play it with friends or on my own occasionally but everytime I do nowadays I just end up irked over one thing or another. I could probably recommend it if you like this sort of thing, but I'd like to list out my problems as someone that's played both a lot of shooters and roguelikes/lites.

Although I'll start with the good, the gunplay and weapon designs are incredible and a ton of fun to mess with, reincarnation is incredible too, the wacky builds you can pull off at that point are a ton of fun. That's really the main positive here, and if that's good enough for you you'll probably love this. It's great for more casual play.

The problems start with the enemies, its not necessarily their attack patterns, their hp, or anything like that. They're well balanced, but for a few reasons they don't *feel* satisfying to fight. The way they move around is kind of awkward, rigid, and janky, its not smooth at all and feels random and just frustrating enough to lower the feel of combat for me. Its not bullshit or anything, but it makes it harder to enjoy the great gunplay and with enough playtime it became harder and harder for me to overlook.

The game has a lot of content, side modes and such that might seem like nice mixups at first but it all ends up being kinda mediocre and I just end up playing reincarnation instead. Spirtual Assault is still a complete mess, its not a bullet sponge hell-hole anymore but its just soooo boring and really highlights the unsatisfying enemy design. It needs to seriously be cut down and better paced, it goes on way too long for how mindless and spammy it is. The final boss for it is designed okay move-wise but is still annoyingly tanky and unfun to fight as a result.

The further you go into the game progression wise the more of a problem the stat system becomes.  It's much better to stick with one weapon early on with good affixes and pump all the money into it. Unless you're playing a character like the dog there's little reason to ever switch between two weapons, ammo is plenty and its way too costly to invest into two weapons when you can just funnel everything into one broken one. 

This isn't inherently a problem necessarily but then it leads to runs becoming samey, you're just waiting until you get an OP combination and then just spamming that weapon at enemies, it leaves the combat loop lacking depth, the only skill thats really rewarded as a result is the ability to dodge enemies. There's no major tactics here, most characters except like, the monkey, have a clearly defined weapon type/s they're good with, so thats what you go for. 

You want shotguns/melee, you play the bird, you want smgs/assault rfiles play the bunny, fire weapons? the fox. I wish the characters were more open-ended in their design, would be much more interesting for builds.

Overall its not a bad game, just a shallow one. Don't go into this one expecting any major complexity or depth. You shoot the bad guys, dodge occasionally, and build around whatever rng has given you. It's a passable way to spend the time, but there's both roguelites and shooters out there that offer way more depth and engaging gameplay than this if thats what you're looking for.

Gunfire Reborn is easily the most polished, feature-rich, and addictive roguelite FPS on the market. The roguelike/roguelite genre as a whole has had a slow journey into the FPS genre-hybrid, and among all of its competitors I would consider Gunfire Reborn to be essentially peerless at the moment. Don't let the whimsical, cartoonish artstyle put you off of an amazingly gratifying instanced looter-shooter experience-- even back in early access this game managed to squeeze roughly 50 hours of playtime out of me, and now that the game is in its finished 1.0 state and is being updated with small character/weapon DLCs, its calling me back for EVEN MORE runs.

The core gameplay in this game is PHENOMENAL. Well paced, deeply satisfying, and deceptively complex. Each weapon you happen upon during a run is amazingly unique and intricate-- and beyond that, each weapon drop comes with an additional set of modifiers to add to its unique characteristics. Gunfire Reborn's weapon roster spans a delightful range of forms & figures; including hefty rocket launchers, nimble SMGs, 'Iron Man' style laser gloves, flaming kunai, and much more. The game's arsenal has something for every mood and every playstyle, which is absolutely crucial to the gameplay loop of any roguelite.
Something else integral to a roguelite's depth is power-ups, or modifiers. Throughout each of its stages, Gunfire Reborn will present the player with heaps of augments to specialize your build. Building a run based on fire damage? Start boosting your elemental DOT! Relying heavily on grenade spam? Increase your grenade's damage or carrying capacity! Feeling sluggish? Why not invest heavily in movement upgrades? This build diversity helps Gunfire Reborn to succeed not just as a first person shooter, but also as a bonafide roguelite.
The level design is fantastic as well in this game! Each zone feels memorable and diverse, as well as being loaded with uniquely challenging enemies. Complete with secret zones, shop/upgrade NPCs, as well as a variety of level bosses, progressing through a run of Gunfire Reborn is a satisfyingly impactful and atmospheric experience, in no small part due to the actual locales it will have you fight your way through.
Speaking of fighting: The enemies you will be pitted against during your run are wonderfully imaginative and (for the most part) always a joy to fight. The game's cartoon style, while perhaps off-putting to some, lends itself to some fantastic enemy designs. Possessed terracotta soldiers, teleporting bird snipers, fireball casting lizard sorcerers, umbrella shaped yokai, giant rocket lobsters-- its all here, and waiting to swiftly end your run. Enemies are also occasionally given special shield/armour bars, which are weak to specific elemental damage types, further deepening the combat/character building experience. Fans of the 'Borderlands' franchise should feel right at home with this elemental weakness/resistance system. At the best of times, Gunfire Reborn's enemy variety serves to give it a frantic, almost "boomer shooter"-esque quality-- and one I find to be sorely lacking among other roguelite FPS games. 
The art direction is very colourful and engaging, and paints a picture of a chaotic, vibrant fantasy world. While the animations aren't necessarily in the same league as the work of modern triple A titles, enemy movement, reload animations, boss attacks, etc... are all very fluid and expressive. Gunfire Reborn might not be a gritty, hardcore take on the FPS genre, it isn't trying to be, and benefits on the whole from its stylization.
Sound design in this game is... mostly pretty good. Gunshots feel impactful, minor FX and embellishments are solid, dealing/receiving damage feels responsive, and the character voice lines are... alright. Gunfire Reborn may not have the same immersive soundscapes as something like CoD or Battlefield, but its eccentric sound design works well within its cartoon artstyle.

Overall, Gunfire Reborn is a deeply mechanically satisfying and nicely polished FPS roguelite, and currently stands out as the absolute best of its hybrid genre. (Not that there's a TON of competition at the moment.) The game is still being updated with free content as well as paid DLCs at the time of writing this review, so its only getting more dense with features as time goes on. Gunfire Reborn is absolutely the type of game that will have you glued to your chair at 3am, promising yourself that THIS run will TOTALLY be LAST ONE of the night. (It won't.) I love this game deeply, and if you're a fan of roguelikes/roguelites and/or FPS games, there's a solid chance that YOU will too.

applist.name: Battlefield™ 2042
applist.detailed_description:
Never back down in Battlefield™ 2042 – Season 5: New Dawn


In Season 5, a new dawn is upon the No-Pats. Head to Czechia, where the warmest welcome you’ll get is down the barrel of a gun. Battle by an abandoned factory retaken by nature on the new map Reclaimed. Expand your arsenal with the XCE Bar bolt-action rifle, the GEW-46 assault rifle, and the powerful BFP.50 hand cannon. As you gather your squad, load up with three new types of grenades and show your foes just how sharp your teeth are. Enjoy a plethora of improvements to Battlefield 2042, including a rework of vehicle loadouts, new weapon stations like thermal tech and heavy anti-air, rehauled Vault weapons, and a reworked version of the Hourglass map. So, show no mercy – and never back down.


Battlefield™ 2042 Elite Edition



Get the definitive version of Battlefield™ 2042. Packed to the brim with value, Battlefield 2042 Elite Edition contains:

  • 4 Seasons' worth of content instantly unlocked: Battle on 17+ maps, wield over 35 weapons, deploy as 14 Specialists
  • “Lost World” Epic Cosmetic Bundle* containing:
    • Epic “Forsaken” Rao Specialist Set
    • Epic “Starved Vulture” Vehicle Skin
    • Epic “Banisher” Weapon Skin



This game includes optional in-game purchases of virtual currency that can be used to acquire virtual in-game items.


About the Game

WELCOME TO 2042

Battlefield™ 2042 is a first-person shooter that marks the return to the iconic all-out warfare of the franchise. Utilize a cutting-edge arsenal in immersive multiplayer battles on maps set in both open battlegrounds and close-quarters maps. Choose your class, rally your squad, and fight through the world of 2042 as well as Battlefield's past.

ALL-OUT WARFARE

[h1] Ignore the Content Creators on YouTube. Not only is it not better, it's just not the Battlefield you wanted [/h1]

[u] Read that title again [/u]

     I'm trying, I'm really trying to enjoy this game. I've put in many hours on launch, as well as on alternate accounts, even playing it on friend's consoles as it was patched, and "fixed", and balanced. It just doesn't work. Many of the issues with the game that aren't related to the terrible map balancing (which is still very prevalent) or the awful weapon design persist here in this title. The overall "feel" of the game is just off, and I can't quite put my finger on it. 

   The bones of the game are still very much geared towards the "Specialist" hero-shooter system that the entire core gameplay was designed around, and no amount of changing or updating is going to fix that. Weapon balancing is still laughable, some weapons generally have a fantastic TTK (Time To Kill) and feel very natural to shoot, while others are laughably nerfed into the point of being useless. I have been able to kill people with a 9mm "carbine pistol" sidearm [i]faster[/i] than I have been able to kill with the same amount of direct hits using the dual 30mm autocannon on the real life equivalent LAV. The M4 Launcher is unable to kill soft-skinned vehicles when they are shot in the rear with multiple rounds. The high-explosive shells of the Abrams are unable to hill soldiers with splash damage when the round detonates on the wall right next to them. 

   [u]It just doesn't work. [/u]

A quick list of grievances;
[list]
    [*] Weapons have no tangible weight to them. Due to the high-speed COD-clone angle that was taken with the gameplay, many of the weapons feel light. Follow-up shots with sniper rifles, being able to consistently understand your drop principle, how many shots it "should" take to down a enemy player. All these things make the ranged gameplay frustrating. Rate Of Fire (ROF) is directly tied to the users framerate, but incoming damage is reflected by game values. Network stutters will lead to you losing a firefight because your weapon went from a 800RPM to a variable 400-600RPM. 

    [*] Vehicle on Vehicle damage seems random at best. Using rounds optimized for defeating armor routinely fail to critically damage enemy vehicles when they are shot from the side or rear. Shooting helicopters has a "roulette" feeling of whether or not it will consistently kill in one hit.

    [*] Cheating is still very prevalent in the game. Wallhacking, insta-downing people with a single shot, or general hyper-mobility are still commonly seen in game.

    [*] Many maps still have design issues when regarding spawn-camping. Many of them become "meat-grinders" if the enemy team is able to push you back to your spawn, with very few capabilities to escape. Spawns [i]have[/i] been improved, but there are still many issues with spawning in line-of-sight of enemy players or armor.

    [*] Vehicles feel pretty terrible to pilot. Granted there are some [u]fantastic[/u] players in this game who execute some amazing moves, but for the rest of us who can't grind this game for 12 hours a day to learn all the quirks the vehicles feel sloppy and inconsistent

   There is a lot to love. The portal system is great for playing a Battlefield that knew what it wanted to be. The speed-swap attachment system is great, and has saved my ass plenty of times. Verticality and movement feels (relatively) smooth and can lead to some really great moments in the game. 

  All this being said, it's just not the Battlefield that fans of Battlefield 4 wanted with the take on the modern shooter. With hackers become more and more rampant on the fan-supported servers for BF4, many of us wanted to turn to 2042 to have an experience that could "scratch that itch". What we instead have is a game that looks like Battlefield, plays like Fortnight, and wanted to be Call of Duty: Modern Warfare.

So, not only EA decided to destroy one of their beloved franchises by making it a generic hero shooter with an unbelievably horrible launch that was legitimately worse than No Man's Sky, but now that they are getting the game at least somewhat into a playable state that should have been the state of the game at release, they are entirely destroying all goodwill they managed to salvage by banning, threatening and harassing non-shill content creators who critique the game and are the only ones actually trying to push them in the right direction. This is not only extremely toxic behavior coming straight out of a billion-dollar company that is behaving like a spoiled brat, screeching and kicking because someone told them they did something bad, but also goes completely against their own terms and services, where it clearly states you can be only punished for in-game transgressions like text chat and VOIP. Meaning EA is actively harassing content creators for the content of their videos.
So if you want to waste your money on this game and support a company that breaks its own rules and harrases people because they have the "wrong", non-approved opinion like some dystopian fascist state from the book 1984, go ahead. Otherwise, get BF4 as that game has more content and players than this game will ever have.

For me, personally, Dice has redeemed themselves. Battlefield 2042 is the best Battlefield.

applist.name: Halo: The Master Chief Collection
applist.detailed_description:
The series that changed console gaming forever is on PC with six blockbuster games in one epic experience.

PC Settings/Optimizations

Halo: The Master Chief Collection is now optimized for PC and looking better than ever at up to 4k UHD and at 60+ FPS.* Other setting options include customizable mouse and keyboard support, ultrawide support, FOV customization, and more.


Campaign

Featuring Halo: Reach, Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary, Halo 2: Anniversary, Halo 3, Halo 3: ODST Campaign, and Halo 4, The Master Chief Collection offers players their own exciting journey through the epic saga. Starting with the incredible bravery of Noble Six in Halo: Reach and ending with the rise of a new enemy in Halo 4, the Master Chief’s saga totals 67 campaign missions over six critically-acclaimed titles.


Multiplayer

Each of the six games in The Master Chief Collection brings its own multiplayer maps, modes and game types. With more than 120 multiplayer maps and countless ways to play with community-created Forge content the Collection has the most diverse and expansive Halo multiplayer experience to date.


Forge

Halo’s iconic map editor is improved, refreshed and better than ever. Build new maps with expanded functionality, increased budget, new objects and create new ways to play with custom game modes.**


*Look to system requirements for guidance on hardware minimum specs to achieve performance metrics.

**Forge mode not available in Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary or Halo 3: ODST.

reviews.review: It's Halo
It's HALO,need to say anything else?!

Great game! I started playing the Halo series in 2009, cementing a high level of love for this series permanently in my mind. With over 2000 hours in the series, I highly recommend multiplayer, either solo or with friends. Playing these games with friends brings back the nostalgia of coming home from a long day and playing all night. I will keep playing until I finally get all the achievements this game offers.

[b]Halo CE:[/b] The grandfather of modern shooters, revolutionized gaming as a whole. While still a great time to play, its age definitely shows. The remastered graphics are a sin to its legacy.

[b]Halo 2:[/b] Likely the best shooter ever created. My favorite in the series. I can't even put into words how much I adore this game. The story, characters, atmosphere, everything is just perfection! (Totally not bias) The remastered graphics did everything right and only enhance the game further!

[b]Halo 3:[/b] Second only to Halo 2, another grand master of shooters, one of the best gaming experiences you can get! No other Halo has captured the same lightning in a bottle this game had. A golden era game.

[b]Halo 3 ODST:[/b] Not my favorite, but by no means a bad game! Telling a great story from a perspective we've not seen before or since in the series.

[b]Halo Reach:[/b] The final game from the Bungie era, a fantastic sendoff to the series. With crisp and more modernized gameplay, It tells a fantastic and gritty story leading up to the events of Halo CE. Yet another that can not be beaten.

[b]Halo 4:[/b] The begging of the end. The first sign of Halo's terminal disease known as 343. The start of the series slow, painful death. Garbage in every way.
Haaah WORT WORT WORT......        Odomaa.

Absolutely cannot recommend. Co-op campaign is unplayable, it constantly disconnects due to network errors and just hard boots you out of the mission. Solutions online suggest you verify integrity of game files (done), cap fps at 60 for all players (done), and finally reconfigure your router settings so that all players have an 'Open NAT'. I remember reconfiguring my router settings 15 years ago to play Halo 3 online, it is asinine that this is still an issue. The MCC was released in 2020 and yet even now network issues persist. Reading through the Steam discussions, these connection errors are very common. I would refund this game if I still could. It is a bare minimum ask that a multiplayer-oriented game have functional co-op multiplayer, which the MCC does not.
Wake me, When you need me.

Trying to push political agendas and then banning anyone who disagrees is peak cringe.

Also, 4 years and the co-op netcode is still not fixed. I'd refund this wretched trashpile if i could.

Halo is one of a kind and has a special atmospheric and dynamic feel to it. Halo is Microsoft's baby, and if you love Microsoft, you will appreciate these games. Regardless if you are not a die-hard Microsoft fan, you will still get lost in the beauty of Halo. If you love sci-fi and one-of-a-kind shooters, then I totally recommend Halo to you.

- Frequent Blue Screens of Death, even after reinstall.
- Many unavoidable game-breaking bugs.
- Some levels literally unplayable, with a crash to desktop or permanent freeze at the start.
- Have to log in with a Microsoft account to play in any mode.

Shockingly bad experience, especially for a large company like Microsoft.

Overzealous and extremely self-righteous unimpartial moderators banning people for innocuous comments aside. 

I'd have to recommend against buying this until they fix major problems which are still unfixed even after half a year. Two of the more standout issues are the memory leak in Halo CE, a major problem where it starts eating your ram like a pig at a candy trough and Halo Reach missing most of its ambiance on certain levels, notably Sword Base. Other issues include terrible netcode in campaign mode, good luck if you try to play anything other than 3 with a friend, lack of split screen, and lack of a dedicated Custom Games Browser that isn't shackled to Easy Anti-Cheat.
No local co-op on PC, gun audio is significantly worse than the originals

applist.name: Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare® II
applist.detailed_description:
Vault Edition


Get the VIP Experience when you purchase the Vault Edition.

Includes:

- Red Team 141 Operator Pack:
-- 4 Operators: Ghost, Soap, Farah and Price
- FJX Cinder - First-Ever Weapon Vault*
- Battle Pass (1 Season) + 50 Tier Skips**
- 10 hours of 2XP and 10 hours of weapons 2XP

You also get access to Call of Duty®: Warzone™ 2.0, the all-new Battle Royale experience.


About the Game

Welcome to the new era of Call of Duty®.

Call of Duty®: Modern Warfare® II drops players into an unprecedented global conflict that features the return of the iconic Operators of Task Force 141. From small-scale, high-stakes infiltration tactical ops to highly classified missions, players will deploy alongside friends in a truly immersive experience.

Infinity Ward brings fans state-of-the-art gameplay, with all-new gun handling, advanced AI system, a new Gunsmith and a suite of other gameplay and graphical innovations that elevate the franchise to new heights.

Modern Warfare® II launches with a globe-trotting single-player campaign, immersive Multiplayer combat, and a narrative-driven, co-op Special Ops experience.

You also get access to Call of Duty®: Warzone™ 2.0, the all-new Battle Royale experience.

I've been a Veteran fan of the series ever since BO1 and would defend this franchise always, but after everything Activision has done to repay back to the few loyal fans of this franchise is absolutely disgusting and needs to be heard.

1. When it was announced that there won't be a COD for 2023 and that MW2 will instead receive a "Premium Expansion", everyone thought that Activision has finally listened to us and won't be releasing another yearly COD and instead allowing a 2 year live-service into MW2 and we all believed in this title which lead to MW2 being the Number 1 best selling game in 2022. What do you do now Activision? Maybe continue the 2 year live-service to make this the best COD since BO2 and continue fixing the game? NO. Instead Activision tricked us all and changes their mind that there will be a COD in 2023 and there will no longer be a "Premium Expansion" but instead a standalone COD release which all of a sudden became MW3??? (Which isn't even being created by Infinity Ward but instead SLEDGEHAMMER).

2. Ok so you fucked up on the 2 Year live-Service and expansion, how is MW2 been? I mean it was advertised as the most innovative and expansive COD of all time. One thing positive i can say is this game definitely had more content at launch, but still we just got yet another Incomplete game that needed more content and bug fixes and SBMM is still is a huge problem that hasn't been fixed at all. While this game has received updates, it has been done very poorly and at a snail's pace. First Warzone/DMZ wasn't even here at launch and had to take a few weeks to be added and we barely get 2 maps a season, a few game modes and a small amount of weapons in which 75% of the weapons are locked behind the battle pass and are insanely overpowered so more players buy the battle pass and instead we get more content focusing on spending money in MW2 like Battle Passes, weapon blueprints, bundles and useless skins and operators like adding Messi or TimTheTatman which seems to be more of Activision's focus instead of fixing or adding content to the game. With all the problems being said, you'd think Activision might've listened to player feedback and try to focus on fixing the game and releasing more updates right? NO. Instead Activision doubles down and releases P2W skins for DMZ making P2W players have an advantage and releasing a £25 Blackcell bundle with a battle pass, Gold skins and Cod Points whereas before that would be the price of two Black ops 1 or 2 expansions adding maps and weapons to the game, and Activision hasn't fixed it's huge problems like the game still not having content and content that should've been at launch and the game CRASHING randomly but instead ADDING more problems into the game like ruining performance for this game, it's actually shocking that COD BO2 had 300 people work on the game and that game was complete with Expansions but this game had over 3000 people working on it but yet they are all incapable and incompetent of fixing the game and releasing content which basically led to players losing interest in this game and leaving.

3. With MW2 being a dumpster fire and players already leaving the game to play older COD games to have fun, what does Activision do now? They see their community and fans having fun in projects like SM2, X Labs, Plutonium or clients like BOIII or CoD 4X, you'd think they maybe should advertise their projects or support them like Valve if they are having fun right? ABSOLUTELY NOT. Activision took the biggest L and became Nintendo by basically sending cease and desist letters ordering the people behind these projects to take them down leading to projects like SM2, X Labs and the BOIII Client being gone now because Activision doesn't know how to make a good COD game and their community doing a way better job than them at making a fun game. These developers spent so much time in these projects and aren't even being paid by Activision to make these and are spending their time to create something fun so people can enjoy but Activision doesn't like to see their fans having fun so they kill their community and fans by doing disgusting tactics like this.

4. The breaking point that lead to this was the security issues, apparently ALL COD GAMES have a security issue that can lead to your IP getting Stolen or your account getting hacked, yes even COD MW2 their newest game is vulnerable to this issue and Activision is doing nothing to stop this. This just proves that they don't care about us having an enjoyable experience in their games but only care when we spend money on their store, they have billions of money and developers in this game yet they continue to disappoint and not let any of their fans have fun in their games yet Indie developers are able to do 10X better than companies like Activision at offering a fun and enjoyable experience. The fact that you can't even offer the bare minimum of players being secure and safe in your NEWEST GAMES shows how Incompetent, Lazy and Out of Touch you people are in 2023.

So after everything that has happened to COD and Activision constantly screwing over their community and fans(where Activision doesn't even deserve any of their fans) We should come together and just outright boycott MW3 releasing this year, yes as much this may sound stupid or petty, Activision is a company that only cares about people buying their games and receiving money and not allowing people having fun or creating projects and quite frankly should deserve a ton of lawsuits and their acquisition with Microsoft/Xbox to fall apart since Activision does not deserve their money or being apart of Xbox. I want to like this game, but Activision sure as hell don't like us. The nasty manipulative money grubbing practices you find in here is disgraceful. Only the guns you buy with real money are good, bundles are over $20 on average and the skins are mostly trash (with a few exceptions) and the skins which are actually nice can cost upwards of $30 including tax! They do everything they can to make you want to buy guns to get the edge in a fight or buy a skin with built in killstreaks so you can fight in DMZ pay to win style!! All they do is try to trick their way into your wallet.

THEN on top of that, the maps are subpar, oddly small with no thought put into spawns or spawn camping, flow of the game, movement, shooting, sniping, ANYTHING! There are 10 different game modes which are all just search and destroy with different names...... why?! The cheaters are rampant and blatant, not even trying to hide, and why would they? Reporting and anti cheat do literally nothing. People literally stream this game cheating and going "Yeah they'll never do anything about it".

I miss the good ol days when I would jump on COD with a few buds and have 'fun'. "Maybe one of us will get a nuke."  or  "OH WORD LET'S GO!! I GOT DOGS"  or  "Hey, who want's to try some dumb strat just for fun!" 

Now it's "Hey I'm on COD.... I'm just on to make some battlepass progress... No I'm not playing warzone or DMZ that shits full of hackers"  or  "Dude why do some of these guns shoot nerf darts, I've hit this guy with half my mag!"  or  "Dude even this guy's team is reporting him for cheating and nothing is being done"  or  "No I only play shipment 24/7. Less cheaters and less game time so I can get off cod faster after grinding some battlepass xp"

That last quote makes me the saddest. No one I know plays cod for fun anymore... we treat it like a job because we spent money on it and don't want to admit that what we did..... was a waste. And I know that I'll play it again because I want to spend time with my friends... I just wish we had a better game to spend time together on. 

I know I'm just one guy, so when I say "I am never buying another COD unless they fix these problems and go back to making the game FUN and not an AFK money farm for their corporate masters"  It's got all the threat of a growling puppy. But it's all I got. I've been burned too many times by these people, and these days... money is too tight to be spending it on a headache. 

I ask you, please, don't waste your time or money here. There are plenty of other games and companies worth your time and money. This game is nothing but an exercise in frustration and manipulative legal robbery.

What Activision has been up to with this series lately has been absolutely despicable. Activision has shut down community driven passion projects, such as SM2 and X (iw4x, etc) for actually caring about their projects. These projects have done NOTHING illegal to warrant a CnD. Activision is trying to eliminate the competition and as a result, they are destroying the community they built with this franchise.

ACTIVISION DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR PLAYERS, WE ARE NOTHING BUT CASH FARMS TO THEM.

DO NOT BUY CALL OF DUTY GAMES.
DO NOT SUPPORT ACTIVISION.
THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT US ANYMORE.

You know I was really looking forward to going over to visit my father and play the co-op games they have in this game. This game does not support split-screen or couch co-op. So yea really was let down and they don't fix their old games in hope you buy their new crap-made games like I was trying play black ops 3 zombies and wont even load... Activision makes Ubisoft look good at times :S Today I lost all respect for Activision I had left in them... god I hate that Blizzard is with this company of trash... OOOh also they disable Game Share I have even less respect for games that do this
I bought this game for 70 American dollars and played it for a week
For SM2

If you really [i]must[/i] spend money, [b]don't buy this game[/b], and just give the cash to a homeless person instead. Or donate to charity. Or spend it on a nice pizza. Literally throwing it into a volcano would be better than spending it on this game. Just don't. There are a million gazillion indie game devs who would be not only more appreciative of your purchase, but also far more worthy.

The game is essentially an inferior MW2019, and while it's a fairly competent shooter at a technical level, the matchmaking [i]is[/i] terrible, it's attached to possibly one of the most egregious and manipulative monetisation systems around, and is run by one of the most predatory and money-grubbing companies in the entire industry who also [i]pioneered[/i] those monetisation systems. 

Whenever you see any promises about this game, remember who publishes it, and what happened to both Overwatch 2 and WC3 Reforged.
Buying a new Call of Duty game is like going back to an abusive ex who swears they changed
Thanks for shutting down SM2.

applist.name: Destiny 2
applist.detailed_description:
Season of the Deep

Destiny 2: Season of the Deep Begins

Mystery and adventure await beneath the waves of Titan.


Into the Abyss

Saturn’s missing moon of Titan has returned, now overrun with Taken and Hive searching for something at the bottom of its methane ocean. Guardians must follow them into the deep to uncover ancient secrets and learn more about the Witness’s origins.


Salvages 


Recover Golden Age tech from sunken Arcology structures on Titan. Explore the seafloor for the first time as you face the Lucent Hive and a variety of enemies in several unpredictable encounters. 

Deep Dives 

Week over week, dive deeper into Titan’s ocean to salvage the power needed to communicate with the mysterious creature you’ve discovered. 


Fishing 

The corruption on Titan is starting to spread off-world. Try to relax and enjoy yourself as you fish for samples around the Solar System. 


Exotic Auto Rifle 

Add the catalyst and rank-100 ornament to Centrifuse as you throw caution to the wind and let the thunder roll. 


Universal Ornaments 

From the vacuum of space to the depths of the ocean, no amount of pressure can stop this style. 

Enhanced Progression 

Over 100 rewards, including XP boosts, Exotic engrams, upgrade materials, cosmetics and more. 

Season Pass 

Gear, XP, rewards! Get the Season Pass and instantly unlock the new Exotic Auto Rifle. Also get XP boosts that speed up Seasonal ranks and reward track unlocks. 

Silver Bundle 


Purchase the Season of the Deep Silver Bundle and receive a new Legendary emote along with 1,700 Silver (1,000 + 700 bonus Silver) which you can use to purchase Seasons, cosmetics, and more! Visit the Seasons tab in-game to use your Silver and buy Season of the Deep. To unlock your new emote, speak with Master Rahool in the Tower.


About the Game

Dive into the world of Destiny 2 to explore the mysteries of the solar system and experience responsive first-person shooter combat. Unlock powerful elemental abilities and collect unique gear to customize your Guardian's look and playstyle. Enjoy Destiny 2’s cinematic story, challenging co-op missions, and a variety of PvP modes alone or with friends. Download for free today and write your legend in the stars.

An Immersive Story

You are a Guardian, defender of the Last City of humanity in a solar system under siege by infamous villains. Look to the stars and stand against the darkness. Your legend begins now.

Guardian Classes

Choose from the armored Titan, mystic Warlock, or swift Hunter.


Titan
Disciplined and proud, Titans are capable of both aggressive assaults and stalwart defenses. Set your hammer ablaze, crack the sky with lightning, and go toe-to-toe with any opponent. Your team will stand tall behind the strength of your shield.

Warlock
Warlocks weaponize the mysteries of the universe to sustain themselves and destroy their foes. Rain devastation on the battlefield and clear hordes of enemies in the blink of an eye. Those who stand with you will know the true power of the Light.

Hunter
Agile and daring, Hunters are quick on their feet and quicker on the draw. Fan the hammer of your golden gun, flow through enemies like the wind, or strike from the darkness. Find the enemy, take aim, and end the fight before it starts.

Cooperative and Competitive Multiplayer

Play with or against your friends and other Guardians in various PvE and PvP game modes.


Cooperative Multiplayer
Exciting co-op adventures teeming await with rare and powerful rewards. Dive into the story with missions, quests, and patrols. Put together a small fireteam and secure the chest at the end of a quick Strike. Or test your team's skill with countless hours of raid progression – the ultimate challenge for any fireteam. You decide where your legend begins.

Competitive Multiplayer
Face off against other players in fast-paced free-for-all skirmishes, team arenas, and PvE/PvP hybrid competitions. Mark special competitions like Iron Banner on your calendar and collect limited-time rewards before they're gone.

Exotic Weapons and Armor

Thousands of weapons, millions of options. Discover new gear combinations and define your own personal style. The hunt for the perfect arsenal begins.

reviews.review:
Since the start of Lightfall and even before that Bungie has started on a path of trying to kill the game instead of making it better. Constant server issues that only get worse with each week while hearing nothing from Bungie on why the issues are occurring, if they will get better, or if they can even be fixed. Mind numbing changes that only seek to hurt the players for no reason.

The most recent stompees nerf that removes all movement speed from the exotic due to controller players not being able to "look up". There is also the titan shoulder charge nerf that now causes you to lose energy after shoulder charging even if it does not hit an enemy. While being a PvP nerf, PvE is being hit by this nerf due to the developers dying on the hill of not separating the sandboxes. While this change may not seem that impactful, let me also add that shoulder charge has worked the same way for the last 9 years. Warlocks are getting starfire not just nerfed but murdered. Starfire has needed a nerf for a while as it is an extremely dominate exotic but instead of nerfing it to be more in line with other exotics the developers have almost made it a punishment to use the exotic. Grenade energy used to be 20% while in an empowering rift and is now down to 2.5%. Lastly, lets talk about the incredible band-aid fixes to the game. The 2 second weapon cooldown. Now if you ever swap weapons in your inventory you have to wait 2 seconds before you are allowed to fire your weapon in a SHOOTER. To give some examples this would be similar to not being able to use the brakes in your vehicle should you accidentally press them or be on a very busy interstate, instead you need to wait 2 seconds. 

Finally, there is the price increase of each expansion and now the increase in prices of seasons by an extra 5 dollars. I'm not even going to get into the costs of the game as in my stance I normally buy the most expensive edition as I play the game a lot unfortunately but going the cheaper route is even more expensive. From the expansions to now increased season price and dungeon keys the game is not only offering so little for that cost but also doing nothing to improve the game server wise, it's only getting worse.

For my last bit of advice, if you are new to the game or think about checking it out and never having played Destiny. 

STAY FAR AWAY

This game is the most unfriendly new player experience I have ever witnessed. Playing through the New Light aka New player experience as an experienced person shows the issues with the game and what it's not teaching new players. The craziest part is this feedback has been given to Bungie the last 2-3 years now and yet they still refuse how to teach new players to play the game. Instead they teach new players how to play a game for their very first time. For instance, they teach you that "Space Bar" is jump instead of teaching you that weapons within destiny have different perk combinations on them, or that subclasses have different benefits and how to properly use them in combat.

From recent events it is apparent that the team that worked on the game during the Beyond Light era and even the Witch Queen era is gone. They are either working on one of the 7 trillion new projects that Bungie has spread themselves too thin doing or went to a new game studio.

Destiny 2 is a black hole for your time.

I find myself coming back every time a new piece of content is dropped, but this is out of no love of the content that I am receiving. Attempting to introduce Destiny 2 to new players reveals the number of fatal flaws this game's business model contains, namely that it's now essentially impossible for new people to get invested in Destiny as a franchise.

Old content has been vaulted away, never to be seen again. This includes but is not limited to the original campaign that this game was offering as it's primary story (of which future content would build upon rather than replace). The story of Destiny 2 is unplayable within Destiny 2, all that remains are DLCs priced the same as full installments for AAA releases.

Lightfall was particulary dissapointing, but arguably the decline began in Shadowkeep, and even the original Red War campaign was never that good. The game is fundamentally a grind-fest, not to mention the numerous arbitrary limitations on resources and currencies to make that grind as painful and tedious as possible.

Harder content that most dedicated players would say is the point of playing the game, like Raids and Dungeons, is either locked behind a seemingly endless line of filler content pretending to be story, or is locked behind a completely arbitrary power cap that is constantly increasing due to rampant power creep.

I could go on but I don't need to.
I will still continue to play this game, purely out of my sunk-cost fallacy.
Bungie, I liked you during the Halo days, but now you've turn sour.

Bring back ALL of the vaulted legacy content, remove all of the arbitrary limit on resources, and actually try to make a DLC campaign that does more than look nice and waste your time (and money). THEN, we'll talk.
pve keeps getting worse and worse, thank god crucible exists

They removed content that I paid for. Yeah it was a long time ago, yeah the content was old, but what the hell. GTFO Bungie. Either give me my content back or my money, then maybe I'll think about buying another one of your expansions.

Also I have well over a thousand hours on xbox, but I have just been bitterly unwilling to touch the game at all now.
its like crack but you get nothing in return
I'm running out of kidneys to sell.
Nobody will read my review, so I'll just say i'm gay.
eh, if you wanna cry everytime you open a game this aint bad
destiny players= no life

I put in over 2500 hours into destiny 1 and over 2000 in destiny 2. I stuck with this game through its few short lived highs and many long term failures. I never had the attitude that Bungie could do no wrong but I wanted to believe  they would continue to evolve the game and make it better. Lightfall launched and I felt like many, it was a huge disappointment and did little if nothing to evolve the franchise. I didn't even finish the campaign, and took a 2 week break from the game 2 weeks later, like someone in an abusive relationship, I decided to log back on and finish the campaign and other content I had paid 100 dollars for/ I was met with a message that said I was banned. This was very confusing to me seeing as I never used cheats or did anything I was aware of that was against T.o.s. There was no way to contact bungie  other than their terribly implemented forums. Upon submitting an appeal all I got in response was that the ban would not be overturned. They did not provide me with any reason as to why I was banned ( because there wasn't one ) . Myself and many others had thousands of hours of their time and over a thousand dollars of content  wrongly taken from them with no recourse and no explanation. I never thought i would say this but because of this i feel bungie is more predatory than activision/ blizzard  in this manner because even they would not issue a permaband with no explanation.

TLDR
Do not play this game unless you wish to have thousands of hours and dollars wrongly taken from you with no explanation why.Any one who gives a dime to this company is setting a dangerous precedent that gaming developers do not have to be accountable to the players who support them. If you're looking for a good mmo experience there are plenty of much better mmos . The game had potential 5 years ago and it was squandered . Not only that but Bungies had decided to cannibalize their most loyal player in a lukewarm attempt to be perceived as doing something to fix the many broken aspects of the game. I don't thing disappointed even sums up how i and many other feel about bungie,
Just dont

the lack of a main story, or even a way to look back on what you missed REALLY holds his game back for new players. as someone who's been playing since taken king, i love this game to death, but its damn near impossible for new people to get into it without watching a 3 hour long video about the story and characters.

I do not recommend this game, I hope no one new plays this game and gives this corporation their hard earned money. I dislike the game's business practices since they infringe on the gameplay and loot available. It's extremely repetitive on the seasonal level as Destiny attempts to be a game you give ALL your time to and its the same thing...every season...Play this game as much as you want but just know that all Bungie's hard work goes to their micro transaction store instead of game play. Save yourself countless hours. The grinds are not worth the highs in comparison to lows. Enjoy as you will I spent like 700 bucks on expansions and dlcs combines since all the days of D1. This game is FPS league of legends. Dont let your friends play it
Nimbus is Destiny 2 Ja Ja Binks.

Don't think I've ever played a fun, exciting game like this that actively suffers from timed content in such a prolific way. There are so many builds that rely on certain weapons that you can't obtain anymore. I'm a returning player who skipped all of Beyond Light Launch and onward until Lightfall, and god it is just so painful to see a cool build or a build that is *required* for some sub-classes to even function well in any meaningful content... And have the weapon that makes the build work require a catalyst that is now a random drop, or you can't even get anymore if you tried. Seasonal weapons have done a great job as the game's life as gone on to address pain points of boring loot and weak rolls, but now a player who has missed even just one season can be behind forever... Now there *are* ways for these weapons to 'come back'. With set rolls on vendors, at random completely indiscernible times for a week at most. I waited for a Calus Mini Tool SMG with demolition and/or Incandescent to be available all the first two seasons of Lightfall for my solar builds (builds that are now much weaker due to season of the deep's mods)... And it just hasn't reappeared. I had to settle for a much less effective weapon and weapon type I could craft just to function on my solar builds. This pattern is repeated with Arc builds this season, where my Thunderlord hasn't gotten a catalyst to drop and I have no good primary/special weapons for arc to use.

Destiny is super fun, really! It's extremely exciting, the effects are all top-notch, enemy design is varied and there is alot of challenging raids and content... But, back when I was playing the game years ago, we didn't have to buy dungeons. We paid less for expansions and seasons, and retained the same amount of content. Now, not only has these been brought up in price, and dungeons now being sold separately from the normal game... Bungie are making more money every year then last. They are making two more brand new games, one of which was just announced. They are not doing this, nickle and diming every last piece of content, to make the game. They are doing it to make a profit. So, as such, these problems amount to alot of frustration. For now, unless you've been playing this game since it started or years prior to this review, avoid at all costs. It's not worth it, period.
Best game I ever played

this game so good and sexy it makes me feel really good especially when i play crucible and i get three or four kills in a single match and my teamates give me commendation play maker i feel  like i really contribute and i played so well maybe i got  win i think honestly if we one v one i beat datto and make him wish he had bin abotterd and never play because i am very skilled especially with ark load out i feel like i am a REAL LIFE WIZERD like i am casting spells and shit i am a real bad ass like i have even done raid and kill orix taken king like i am not someone to mess around with so if ur playing destiny wihth me just so u know i am the fucking real deal

Please DO NOT buy the BTS meal if you don’t stan them. You’re preventing the actual BTS fans who have waited for months from having the BTS meal experience. Eating the sauces without understanding their significance is literally cultural appropriation and it’s not okay.

Its a job that makes you pay to have fun but in reality it isn't fun just time consuming fun, how ever we all still play it because we have dumped so much time and money this far so might as well play it.  Its the same content over and over again.  If you start this late or even miss one day you will be so far behind that its not worth it.  With the negatives said and done, it truly is an amazing game.
this game is so amazing i love when the servers are down for hours and i can't play it

applist.name: DayZ
applist.detailed_description:
Join our Discord


About the Game

This is your Story


There are no map markers, daily quests, or scoreboards to help you create your story. There is only Chernarus – 230 square kilometers of post-Soviet country that was struck by an unknown virus, which turned the majority of its population into raging infected.

Your task? To survive the collapse of civilization for as long as you possibly can. Keep in mind that death is permanent in unforgiving Chernarus. All you’ll have when you start over again are the memories of your final mistake.

Meet Others


Up to 60 players are struggling to survive by any means necessary at any given time. Make friends, kill on sight, build a base, or risk being betrayed over a can of tasty beans. Use VOIP to interact with other players however you see fit. Every encounter is meaningful when your life is always on the line. Be wary. Stay alert. Trust no one.

Survive Chernarus


The infected aren’t the only ones you need to worry about – there’s also the wildlife and elements. Evade packs of wolves and frenzied bears, find shelter from the punishing rain, search for light in the darkness of night. You’ll also need to master complex survival mechanics concerning your hunger, thirst, body temperature, and more.

Loot Up


Always make sure your gear is ready. Patch up damaged clothes, craft improvised items, and head out to deceptively dead cities to scavenge for valuable resources. Fix a car and hide it in your secret base under a cover of well-placed traps. Step into contaminated zones if you dare and keep your eyes peeled for precious loot. Don’t forget that you won’t get far without a full hazard suit and gas mask.

Take your Shot


Intense PvP action can break out anywhere at any time, especially in hotspots like abandoned military bases, where heart-pounding firefights are all the rage. Some survivors want your loot, others are simply hunting for sport. Then there are those who are afraid you’ll shoot first. Learn how to fight and know when the time has come to swallow your pride and flee. One bullet can change absolutely everything. Always watch your back.

Install Mods


Head on over to the Steam Workshop and find a customized server that fits. Join an active community of like-minded players and modify your DayZ experience to suit your taste. Browse thousands of fan-made features, maps, and guns – all of which are easily managed directly from the game launcher.

applist.short_description: How long can you survive a post-apocalyptic world? A land overrun with an infected "zombie" population, where you compete with other survivors for limited resources. Will you team up with strangers and stay strong together? Or play as a lone wolf to avoid betrayal? This is DayZ – this is your story.

reviews.review: After a few hours I managed to steal all the food and guns from all the houses in the city, killed 6 people, took their clothes, smoked weed and then i went back home to eat what i found. Then i got bored and hopped on dayz with my kitten and had the best experience of my life. 10/10 recommend it
Hands down one of the best games I have ever played. It gives you a unique survival experience that no other game has came close to replicating. 10/10
2k hours had some fun

Game is about a decade old and the zombies still glitchily bounce around, phase through doors, walls, you and your attacks. Gunshots don't register, suppressed shots pull every zombie with a 20 km radius. Zombie path finding is absurd, you run through the woods, through 15 buildings across a river and over a mountain and the zombie chasing you is on your ass and not even broken a sweat. Loot spawn sucks. You get hungry / die of starvation way too quickly. Trying to constantly repair your gear sucks. Weapons break after 5 swings/shots. Sickness sucks, in the "cold" for 2 seconds? Fatally ill. The new sprain/broken leg system sucks, get hit by one zombie? Broken leg, wince and blurred screen with every step. Oh and good f**king luck finding a vehicle.

Game is just laborious.  After all this time they've made it prettier, it gets good frame rates. But what does it matter when the core game is still ass.
zombies. rain. pain.
You'll need at least an entire day to figure out how to play unmodded. Combat mechanics feel ancient.
If you ask a DayZ player if DayZs gameplay is fun they get mad

Played this game a few years back with a friend. Found it to be a buggy mess and mostly a grind with a frustrating UI. Now, years later, I'm playing it with friends I'm finding it to be a buggy mess with frustrating UI. This feels like a game made by people that hate people who play games. There's very little fun about finding an item only for it to break and be useless after fighting 3 zombies or opening 2 cans of food. 2/10 and that feels generous.
its a trap, don't do it.
very nice i ran 50km to find a gun without mag and only on bullet i run another 50km to find a guy with full gear i got killed then i run another 50 km a very nice game good for your legs
fire game
Can't even find rocks.
Do not trust anyone!
great game
Only good if you play with friends.When u play alone u can play for max 2h and get borred so fast.Overall good game,still best survival game
Played this game ever since the original release (way back when) It has its problems but its like no other survival game out there and it offers a very unique gaming experience <3

I've been playing this game since the first weeks. It was a shame at the time. Most of my friends got disgusted by the bugs poor contents etc BUT with (many, many) years passing, it became stable, with better content and a pretty fair balance in the loot economy, PVE / PVP challenges etc. I still love to play it from time to time, Chernarus is beautiful and whomever loves sandbox games may love this one.
It's been 10 years since the last time I've launched this game. It's still janky AF.
I got to eat a human. YUMMY
it good

applist.name: The Elder Scrolls Online: Necrom
applist.detailed_description:
WHICH EDITION IS RIGHT FOR ME?

WHICH EDITION IS RIGHT FOR ME?[/h2]

The Elder Scrolls Online Collection: Necrom and The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Collection: Necrom includes the base game, Necrom and all previous Chapters (High Isle, Blackwood, Greymoor, Elsweyr, Summerset and Morrowind). Those who purchase the Deluxe Collection: Necrom will also receive the Deluxe in-game items. Players purchasing the Collection editions can jump right into the base game, Necrom or any previous Chapter right away.

The Elder Scrolls Online Upgrade: Necrom and The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Upgrade: Necrom includes Necrom only, plus Deluxe in-game items for those who purchase the Deluxe Upgrade: Necrom.


Digital Deluxe Edition

DELUXE


Those who purchase The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Upgrade: Necrom or The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Collection: Necrom will receive the Deluxe in-game items, including:

  • All past Chapter Collector's Edition / Deluxe items** (only included in The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Collection: Necrom)
  • Hermitage Servitor mount
  • Cipher's Eye Pocket Watcher pet
  • Dark Lady's Headrest memento
  • Knowledge Eater Armor outfit style
  • Leaning / Sitting / Standing Scholar emotes

**Does not include past Chapter pre-order / pre-purchase in-game items.


About the Game

Begin a unique adventure filled with the unparalleled storytelling and deep lore of The Elder Scrolls. Journey to Tamriel - a living, breathing, fantasy universe of magnitude, where your choices shape your experience. Battle, loot, craft, steal or role-play as an archer, mage, merchant, scholar or warrior. Play solo or with friends and combine equipment and abilities to suit your own play style. No game subscription required - buy once, play anytime.

NECROM


UNLOCK THE NEW CLASS - Become empowered by the secrets of Apocrypha and the forbidden knowledge of Hermaeus Mora. The Arcanist is a powerful new Class capable of destructive, restorative, or defensive magic by channelling the arcane, ancient runes, and lost tomes of power.

ALL-NEW ZONES - Explore the Telvanni Peninsula, home of colossal mushrooms, arcane magic, rocky spires and the capital city of Necrom, additionally, behold the forbidden books of the endless library of Apocrypha.

A COSMIC STORY - The Prince of Fate holds secrets too dangerous for mortals or Daedra to comprehend. Now hidden yet turbulent powers threaten Hermaeus Mora's realm of Apocrypha and if the Daedric Prince's secret is uncovered, it could unravel all of reality.

NEW WARDEN AND ARCANIST CLASS COMPANIONS - Two new allies seek grand quests and glory! Unlock the Arcanist-power-wielding Redguard and Argonian Warden Companions to battle by your side and keep you company on your journey across Tamriel.

COLLECTION†


Purchase The Elder Scrolls Online Collection: Necrom or The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Collection: Necrom to get instant access to all major Chapter zones, biomes and quest arcs from across Tamriel. The Collection: Necrom[i/] and Deluxe Collection: Necrom includes the base game, Necrom and all previous Chapters, as below (plus Deluxe items for those who get the Deluxe Collection: Necrom).

  • Necrom (NEW in 2023)

    Unlocks instantly:
  • High Isle
  • Blackwood
  • Greymoor
  • Elsweyr
  • Summerset
  • Morrowind
  • Base game

†Those who purchase The Elder Scrolls Online Upgrade: Necrom or The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Upgrade: Necrom will receive the Necrom Chapter - or Necrom Chapter and Deluxe items, respectively - these versions do not include the previous Chapters or the base game.

reviews.review: Easily one of the best expansions in years. Finally back to the quality of Morrowind. My only hope for the future is they give themselves a break from content releases to make a massive and overwhelming expansion. This would certainly be worth the wait
Tentacles, cool Eldritch class, edgelord argonian companion... 10/10.
this is the best Expansion in a recent years. especially this Apocrypha, this place has an interesting story. they nailed it ! shout out to Arcanist class, really fun !

I have always wanted to like this game, and I often come back to it in the hope that I might. For me, the combat doesn't capture the actual feeling of casting spells, and tactical elements like movement, defense, and control make up of less of the combat than I'd prefer. I feel it makes things things lack depth and more of just a slugfest.

Overall, not a terribly designed class concept on Arcanist, I think its more the core mechanics of ESO that are just not for me. Which is frustrating, because the concept of aiming, along with active block, dodge, and interrupt to off balance are good mechanics. 

One other complaint is that solo PVE questing difficulty remains mind numbingly easy, without much need to really utilize those core mechanics listed above. It was a complaint I had with World of Warcraft as well, and following this model of being able to pve in any zone at any time sort of removed the challenge, which was what required building skill and equipment. In order for such a repetitive game model as an MMO to stay engaging for me, it has to require that combat, as it represents a majority part of playtime, be more reactive than something that simply relies on the same constant rotation of a meta spec.

Necrom is something of a return to form for ESO DLC content; it shows that Zenimax actually does listen to what the players want in some regard.

Positives:
- New class.
- No more of the “year-long adventure” nonsense, always hated those.
- Fun main quest, much more interesting than the previous four.
- Lots of new sets and mythics to collect, as well as other collectibles.

Negatives:
- Some parts feel somewhat unfinished / rushed (e.g. only two collectible motifs, compared to many more in previous DLCs).
- The ever-increasing dependency on previous DLCs to access new content, such as digging up antiquities or the card drops.
- Recycled assets from the Morrowind and Deadlands expansions. It would have been nice if the Telvanni Peninsula had a more unique identity rather than just being a clone of Vvardenfell, something more akin to how Tamriel Rebuilt portrayed it would have been much better.

All in all, Necrom’s not perfect, but it’s a step in the right direction, which gives me hope for future ESO expansions.
Arcanist is a blast to play, quite distinct from the other classes. Haven’t finished the entire story just yet but Apocrypha is beautiful.

Tldr.: Great expansion, maybe even the best in years. 

I've played this game for years, and while I adored High Isle (the Chapter before this one), I felt that the direction the game was going in unsatisfactory. But this? This is from what I've been able to play an amazing chunk of content. Interesting stories, a fun new class to play ass, cool characters, a stunning new part of the world to explore, and many neat little collectibles to earn really make me think that this is a good new direction for the game to take. More of this please! 

Oh, and thanks for supporting Tales of Tribute, the Card-game added in High Isle. I LOVE this game and today I was pleasantly surprised to find that Necrom also adds a new Deck to play with. Can't wait to unlock that. :D

I’ve been playing elder scrolls for a long time, and ESO for the last 3 years.
This is without a doubt the best chapter/update I’ve played on ESO to date.
You can tell that they really “took their time” with this one.

Best expansion in years and a great addition to the game, went in with overly low expectations but have been pleasantly surprised with the overall experience and having a very enjoyable time compared to past expansions over the years. Haven't enjoyed a new release this much since Elsweyr.
Outstanding Expansion. New Story, Two New Areas, New Dungeons, Two New Allies/Companions, & a Whole New Class to dive into.
Hermaeus Mora my beloved 💚

Best expansion since Summerset. If you're skeptical because of the trainwreck that was the past 2 "year long adventures" know that Necrom is back to form in the most spectacular way possible. Apocrypha is gorgeous, the new class is fresh and unique, and the Telvanni Peninsula has some of the coolest lore and worldbuilding that I've seen from this game; perfect time to return.
They added hentai
Love it!
greatest game ever....
After years they give update with so much bling bling effects, good looking arcanist
funny big tentacle thing talks to you, new class and nice new areas, i approve

Nothing worse the money here.
Re-used models from past.
Again same useless stuff like non combat pets and mounts (mounts are model from past again)
story is boring
New class is meh
still very unfair prices for what devs are doing. 

Best advice:save your money play something else.

applist.name: Assassin's Creed® Odyssey
applist.detailed_description:
Ultimate Edition



Enhance your Assassin's Creed® Odyssey experience with the ULTIMATE EDITION, including the game, the DELUXE PACK and the SEASON PASS.

Continue your epic odyssey with two new, major story arcs in the SEASON PASS with three exciting episodes per story.
Season pass owners also receive the games Assassin's Creed III REMASTERED and Assassin's Creed Liberation REMASTERED.


Gold Edition



Enhance your Assassin's Creed® Odyssey experience with the GOLD EDITION including the game and the SEASON PASS.

Continue your epic odyssey with two new major story arcs in the SEASON PASS with three exciting episodes per story.
Season pass owners also receive the games Assassin's Creed III REMASTERED and Assassin's Creed Liberation REMASTERED.


Deluxe Edition



Upgrade your game experience with the DELUXE EDITION which includes the game and the Deluxe Pack.

The Deluxe Pack  includes:
- The Kronos Pack (Including 5 epic pieces of armour, 1 epic weapon, 1 epic mount)
- The Herald of Dusk Pack (Including 5 rare pieces of armour, 1 rare weapon)
- The Capricornus Naval Pack (Including 1 ship design, 1 crew theme)
- 1 Temporary XP Boost
- 1 Temporary Drachmas Boost


About the Game

Choose your fate in Assassin's Creed® Odyssey.
From outcast to living legend, embark on an odyssey to uncover the secrets of your past and change the fate of Ancient Greece.

TRAVEL TO ANCIENT GREECE
From lush vibrant forests to volcanic islands and bustling cities, start a journey of exploration and encounters in a war torn world shaped by gods and men.

FORGE YOUR LEGEND
Your decisions will impact how your odyssey unfolds. Play through multiple endings thanks to the new dialogue system and the choices you make. Customize your gear, ship, and special abilities to become a legend.

FIGHT ON A NEW SCALE
Demonstrate your warrior's abilities in large scale epic battles between Athens and Sparta featuring hundreds of soldiers, or ram and cleave your way through entire fleets in naval battles across the Aegean Sea.

GAZE IN WONDER
Experience the action in a whole new light with Tobii Eye Tracking. The Extended View feature gives you a broader perspective of the environment, and the Dynamic Light and Sun Effects immerse you in the sandy dunes according to where you set your sights. Tagging, aiming and locking on your targets becomes a lot more natural when you can do it by looking at them. Let your vision lead the way and enhance your gameplay.
Visit the Tobii website to check the list of compatible devices.
-----
Additional notes:
Eye tracking features available with Tobii Eye Tracking.

content_descriptors.notes: This is an action-adventure game in which players assume the role of Alexios or Kassandra, mercenaries on a quest for vengeance. As players explore an open-world environment in Ancient Greece, they interact with characters, infiltrate enemy bases and strongholds, and kill human enemies. Players use swords, spears, and bows to kill enemy soldiers and bandits in melee-style combat. Players also use stealth attacks (e.g., knife stabbing) to dispatch enemies discreetly. Large blood-splatter effects occur as enemies are killed. A handful of cutscenes depict more intense acts of violence and/or gore: characters stabbed through the head/neck with bladed weapons; young characters thrown off a cliff; a man mauled by a mob as his arm gets thrown into the air. Some environments depict severed limbs and dismembered corpses on the ground. The game contains instances of sexual material: characters kissing and caressing before the screen fades to black (sex is implied though never shown); dialogue referencing sex and prostitution (e.g., “Anything goes in this sex andron”; “That is love, this is commerce. What are you into?”); a character hearing sexual moaning sounds behind a door. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” are heard in the game.

reviews.review: Comes with a malware named Ubisoft launcher.exe

A playable game from Ubisoft.

That's all the praise I can give.

[h1] You can bang almost everyone 10 outta 10 [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
[b] Spoiler free review [/b] 

nah but for real:
Really amazing how far graphics has come, and the scale of the maps. This game is definitely beautiful and large. 

The story is amazing, if you like the main thing in the lore of Assassins creed, this game definitely gives you a lot of info on it. And choices you make matter, i will definitely be playing it with new game+ and do things that i wish i had done differently. But i recommend you to play it not knowing what choices do what down the line, since you can play as the female [spoiler] Kassandra [/spoiler] , and or the male [spoiler] Alexios [/spoiler].

At the start of the game i felt a bit overwhelmed by everything, but after exploring a bit and doing some quests i got a hang of it. 
in comparison to Origins, its not as good, but its still a Master piece!

The main quests and side quests are great, but there are these quests all around that have a time glass on them, those quests feel poorly made. Most of the dialogue in those quests are interesting at the start, but then when it comes to what they want you to do, it defaults to the same ones over and over and over again. so i just skip the dialogue most of the time. Although very rarely they will say something new. Often you get a dialogue decision to ask them what they want from you, but its always just answer nr1, so it feels tedious, like they added it in to make you want to listen to the dialogue, which after 100 hours, I don't. These quests are also the main way (from what I've seen) to get XP and money, and they are usually very short and just boring.

For some reason they designed the horse to trot when you are 200 meters within a city, town, fort or whatever, and it doesn't matter if its way above you on a cliff, your horse will not gallop. Which is extremely annoying and i don't understand why they did this

They have a great system for your armor and weapons, where you can change the look of your armor to any you have received. although i don't understand why epic armor has 3 engravings enabling you to get 4, while the legendary armor only has 2 unless you have the complete set which then you get 3, plus you could add the 4th. but this makes the epic armor way better in most cases, as you can get much better engravings on them than the legendary. 

The combat is alright, similar to Origins except you don't have a shield.

The game doesn't really tell you how to change arrows except in the loading screens where it occasionally pops up telling you to press g to switch arrows, didn't see that hint until like 40 hours in, and at that point i just googled it.

The boat battles are cool, and different from the old games, in a good way. the upgrades get ridiculously expensive, but you make the money back fast, but the resources can be a hassle.

I have a lot more I could say about this game, but I think I've covered what stood out the most for me

I Recommend this game, you get a long playtime and it has good replay value.

Got a sad cat here, waiting for a new AC game. Friends passing by can touch her and click Like to pet her once. Award for good luck, Take My Points for infinite pets :)
