Assassin's Creed Odyssey is a highly immersive and detailed action-adventure game from Ubisoft. From the stunning Ancient Greek landscapes and cities, to the engaging storyline and engaging combat and stealth mechanics, this game has a lot of exciting content and provides hours of quality entertainment. With its big open world packed with side-quests, bounties and mysterious artifacts to uncover, this game will keep you hooked for weeks. One of the most standout aspects of the game is its incredible attention to detail, with period-accurate buildings, characters, and artwork. The game also features an engaging narrative that takes its time to tell, allowing for some truly fascinating moments that will leave a lasting impression. With its deep character customization and upgrade systems, Odyssey also provides a unique and varied experience that can be tailored to the player’s preference. While some aspects of the game can be tedious, it never detracts from the overall experience, and the engaging gameplay kept me coming back for more. Assassin’s Creed Odyssey is an enjoyable action-adventure game with an enormous amount of content, engaging combat, and an interesting storyline. Its immersive world and varied mechanics provide an enjoyable, memorable experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and engaging game.
assasin game about assasins where you assassin against other assasin or not assassissin you are the best assassin in all assassin assasin so assassin

First of all, as preface, I have achieved basically 100% in this game including the two DLCs so one could I say I really love and adore this game. 

Having said that, this game is definitely not a perfect game for everyone. The story is a tad bit bland overall and isn't what hooked me in this game. I mostly ignored the main quest really until I powered through it in one or two sittings. Adding to that, this game didn't feel as much as a typical game in the Assassins Creed series but more as a RPG in the world of Assassins Creed, which is totally fine for me because it's still a great game, but I understand everyone who was a little disappointed.
What really chained to this game though, is the world building and the main character (DISCLAIMER: I played as Kassandra). 
Kassandra to me, was one of the most loveable (and hot; I admit it :) ) protagonists I've ever played with. I love her personality and attitude but also the genuine sorrow and grief they were able to make her show. On top of that, her voice actress/also her motion double did such an outstanding job.
Now to the world the developing team put out: I'm not from Greece and hvae only been there a few times, but I absolutely loved every second of exploring the ancient version. They really made the world feel alive and inhabitated and while fulfilling objectives on the map was, due to it being mostly Copy and Paste as Ubisoft typically does, pretty boring most of the times, I still had the motivation to keep going the whole distance. And let me tell you: The world is actually enormous. Part of the reason I kept going definitely were the mechanics overall and especially during fighting. The ability tree is really well made and almost all abilities feel useful at some point and in some build. Naturally some abilities are generally more useful than other but the overall balance is very good.

In short: I really enjoyed the game and it is a really good RPG, probably one of the best I have ever played and I enjoyed every second I played.
Trust me, Guys. The game is just fine but the Ubisoft Connect is awful

A Dazzling Journey through History: Assassin's Creed

Rating: ★★★★★

Assassin's Creed, the long-standing franchise known for its captivating blend of historical settings and thrilling stealth gameplay, once again delivers an exceptional experience with its latest installment. This time, players are transported to a meticulously crafted world where they can dive into the rich tapestry of history and embark on an unforgettable adventure.

The attention to detail in Assassin's Creed is nothing short of remarkable. From the bustling streets of ancient Rome to the vibrant markets of Renaissance Florence, every historical period is beautifully recreated, immersing players in a captivating and authentic atmosphere. The level of historical accuracy is commendable, and it's evident that the developers have poured their hearts into recreating these iconic time periods.

i love this game. around 80 hours in this playthrough and i still have so much to do! this game is so detailed and you can tell they worked really hard on it. and, even if you arent the kind of person who usually plays assasins creed, youll like this one. its still similar to the others in ways but its also different in others. i think its a great addition to the franchise and a good first AC to play, because of this game i also have origins, valhalla, 3, and liberation. 12/10

graphics are good even on lower settings, voice actors did great, and u can tell people worked hard on this. <3
It's not the best AC game but it's definitely fun to play. I love being immersed in the world at the time, this game seems to do it well. Not quite as good as Origins but definitely up there.

applist.name: Assassin's Creed Valhalla
applist.detailed_description:
Comparison Grid


Complete edition



Includes the base game, the season pass, the Ultimate Cosmetics Pack, and the Dawn of Ragnarök Expansion!

In Assassin’s Creed® Valhalla, you are Eivor, a fierce Viking warrior raised on tales of battle and glory. Explore a mysterious and beautiful open world set against the brutal backdrop of England’s Dark Ages.

- Season pass content includes: Wrath of the Druids and The Siege of Paris expansions.
- Ultimate Pack features the Berserker Bundle (Gear Set, Settlement Pack, and Longship Pack).
- Dawn of Ragnarök Expansion: Embrace your destiny as the Norse god Odin and complete your saga.

Includes Forgotten Saga, a FREE new rogue-lite game mode for all Assassin's Creed Valhalla players.


Ragnarok Edition



Includes the game and the epic Dawn of Ragnarök expansion!

In Assassin’s Creed® Valhalla, you are Eivor, a fierce Viking warrior raised on tales of battle and glory. Explore a mysterious and beautiful open world set against the brutal backdrop of England’s Dark Ages.

In Assassin’s Creed Valhalla: Dawn of Ragnarök, the most ambitious expansion in franchise history, Eivor must embrace their destiny as Odin, the Norse god of Battle and Wisdom. Unleash new divine powers as you embark on a desperate quest through a breathtaking world. Complete a legendary Viking saga and save your son in the face of the gods’ doom.

Includes Forgotten Saga, a FREE new rogue-lite game mode for all Assassin's Creed Valhalla players


Deluxe Edition



Includes the game and Ultimate Pack, which contains the Berserker Gear Pack, Berserker Settlement Pack, Berserker Longship Pack, and more!

Strike fear into the hearts of your enemies with the Ultimate Pack cosmetic items, including:
- The Berserker Gear Pack: the Bearded Axe, a new Raven skin, the ferocious Hati Wolf Mount, and more.
- The Berserker Longship Pack: a majestic Longship with a unique figurehead and sails.
- The Berserker Settlement Pack: new ways to customize your settlement in England.
- A Set of Runes to sharpen weapons or improve gear.

Includes the Forgotten Saga, a FREE new rogue-lite game mode for all Assassin's Creed® Valhalla players.


About the Game



Become Eivor, a legendary Viking raider on a quest for glory.

- Lead epic Viking raids against Saxon troops and fortresses.
- Relive the visceral fighting style of the Vikings as you dual-wield powerful weapons.
- Challenge yourself with the most varied collection of enemies ever in Assassin's Creed.
- Shape the growth of your character and your clan's settlement with every choice you make.
- Explore a Dark Age open world, from the harsh shores of Norway to the beautiful kingdoms of England.

Includes the Forgotten Saga, a FREE new rogue-lite game mode for all Assassin's Creed® Valhalla players.

reviews.review: man i am not sure how long left to finish the game but i get bored it's just the same missions over and over but different location and characters

This one feels like an oversimplified version of Origins and Odyssey. Almost everything - gameplay, story, NPCs, riddles, collectibles, side missions, you name it - are a step back from previous titles. Also, this is the first openworld game I know which will punish you for exploring. Game wants you to follow the story and not to take a step in any other direction. And as a bonus - there are still crashes and game breaking bugs presents.
Where are the achievements?

I would HIGHLY recommend completing the main game before doing any of the dlc. The reason for this is that some items (noden's arc, excaliber, thor's armor and hammer) are only obtained near end game or AFTER end game in the case of thor's hammer. And then there is nothing left to do. there is no new game plus. no new quests. So it's kind of better to wait to do the dlc so you can actually enjoy the ISU artifacts.

After 220 hours , just to see if there was any change to the modern day Assassins creed story-line and i was quite impressed by it. On the other hand , the Vikings story-line is boring after a few hours. Anyway , it's recommended for the people who likes to grind for fun , other than that it is not worth it. Let's just hope for the best from 'Mirage'.

Better combat and perk system than Odyssey, and the removal of naval warfare is a positive for me. That said the gear system is VASTLY worse in this game IMO. Worth on sale. 

Edit: I didn't realize this game had gotten such poor feedback. Seems to be trendy to hate on AC games, sure it's quite expensive and similar to previous titles. But it delivers a TON of content with a decent story and introducing many new systems. Playing on the highest difficulty the combat has actually been fairly challenging with many different types of fights and unique enemies. If you liked Odyssey and Origins, chances are you will like this game as well. I am not one to stick up for Ubisoft, but it's a bit silly to see so many people jumping on the hate-bandwagon.

It would be tempting to give Valhalla a less than favorable review. Over the years the countless sequels in the franchise, and following in the footsteps of such epic masterpieces as Origins and Odyssey has certainly numbed our senses. It might feel mediocre until you actually try any other of the less polished competitors to realize how masterly crafted it is. Surprisingly the main reason it feels so bland is because almost everything is in it's place, within a seamless world, with excellent story arcs, surprise cameos, plausible and clever plot twists smooth and a lot more.

It has it's issues - random freezes here and there, some effort/reward discrepancies, minor inconveniences but the positives, especially if you can take it as a standalone product and not just another brick in the series are truly overwhelming.
A very very very mid game

Disappointingly unengaging and lacking in inspiration. The world feels empty and lifeless. The story is so drawn out and basic. Don't get me started on all the historic and social inaccuracies. 

This seemingly endless "experience" demanded a staggering 80 hours of my time, yet it could have easily been condensed by 40-50 hours, making me feel like I wasted less of my life.

For what fun there is, it isn't worth the price tag. If you are a fan of the AC games, get this on a huge discount only.

Let me preface that I have enjoyed this game. Not as much as Odyssey but still.

However, I do not support Ubisoft's Practices of not including features that should be included from the start (Achievements where?). This carries on with the Lack of Mirage from the start. Or Origins which I played on Ubisoft+, wanted to buy here only to refund it because the savegames are not cross-compatible ^^ 

If you fix these issues Ubisoft, this review will change. But until then, it will be a no.
no achivements, no good rating

[h1]A Viking Odyssey Unfolds: My Enduring Journey with Assassin's Creed Valhalla[/h1]

Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ (5/5)

[b]As the epic tale of Assassin's Creed Valhalla continues to unravel, I find myself captivated by the Norse world that unfolds before me. Even after spending countless hours immersed in this Viking adventure, my enthusiasm for the game remains unwavering.[/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2946302920

[b]From the moment I stepped foot into the vast open world of Valhalla, I was instantly swept away by its breathtaking landscapes and attention to detail. The lush forests, towering mountains, and shimmering lakes create a backdrop that feels both familiar and mysterious, inviting exploration at every turn.[/b]

[b]The heart and soul of Valhalla lies in its engrossing storyline. Eivor's journey, filled with triumphs, tragedies, and complex character relationships, has kept me eagerly anticipating each new chapter. The game masterfully weaves historical events and mythology, allowing me to delve into the rich tapestry of Norse culture while engaging in the age-old battle between the Assassins and Templars.[/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2954771704

[b]Combat in Valhalla is a visceral experience. The weighty swings of Eivor's axe and the precise strikes of the hidden blade deliver a satisfying sense of power. Whether I choose to face my foes head-on or take a more stealthy approach, the combat mechanics are fluid and gratifying. The addition of raids and epic battles adds a grand scale to the Viking conquest, making each clash a thrilling spectacle.[/b]

[b]One aspect that truly sets Valhalla apart is the attention given to side quests and activities. From hunting legendary beasts to engaging in captivating mini-games, there is always something new to discover. The depth of the world-building shines through these diversions, making me feel like an integral part of the Viking society and forging lasting connections with the game's characters.[/b]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2969869917

[b]The commitment of the development team to post-launch support is commendable. Regular updates and expansions bring fresh content, ensuring that my journey never stagnates. The passion for the game and its community is palpable, making Valhalla an evolving experience that continues to surprise and delight.[/b]

[b]Even though I am still playing Assassin's Creed Valhalla, I can confidently say that it has become a timeless adventure for me. Its compelling narrative, immersive world, satisfying combat, and ongoing support make it a true masterpiece in the Assassin's Creed series. Skål to Ubisoft for crafting a game that continues to hold me captive, and I eagerly await the next chapter in this extraordinary Viking saga.[/b]

It feels weird to say that there is "too much" game but it feels like a pretty bloated game with a lot to do sure, but a lot of it is grinding and the same few mission repeating over and over. It seriously took me 12 hours to get through the prologue. But it's very beautiful though, and if you can get over the grindyness you might enjoy it. Those first 12 hours exploring the nice mountains of Norway was nice. Makes me kinda wish the game stayed around there. Also why the hell is there a cash shop in a single player game that you're still selling for full price?!
You took away achievements simply to push your crappy app? Really?
charging 140$ for the "complete edition" of a game that isnt complete

Although I certainly enjoyed the 60 hours that I played, this game just has no life to it. Odyssey was a game that involved a long grind I had 100 hours!), but in that game you would enjoy the grind since the characters and atmosphere were vibrant with rich stories behind them, which you do not get in the gloomy hell of Valhalla, The lifeless characters and atmosphere prevent you from feeling motivated to finish the game. In the end, it is a good game at the start, but as a whole repetitive and eventually: boring.

This game was interesting at first. The combat was difficult, the tactics of Odyssey don't work the same, and the story was compelling enough. There was a point early on where your actions while roaming seemed to have consequences, so I was hopeful. But as it went on... combat became universally easy. Before midgame, I was already unstoppable. I never needed to eat rations anymore. The puzzles were just "Find the oil jar and carry it to the breakable wall" or "Shoot the breakable part of the wall just under the roof and climb through" over and over, for supplies I haven't needed ever because they become literally free in bulk for some ungodly reason or silver for settlement decorations. Whoop-de-doo. The fishing takes forever for minimal rewards, Orlog was a decent time-killer, but not very helpful, flyting was actually cool, but ultimately a small part of the game. Even the DLC stuff only seemed to give you cosmetics or weapons and armor that were worse than what you already had.
But what I hated was the lack of any actual choices. They'd always present seemingly important decisions, and as soon as you think it through and make a decision, the game would make it painfully obvious that the choice didn't matter. Solve a mystery and identify a traitor? Doesn't matter, Eivor will [spoiler]explain that that's the guy in private and then stand back as he monologues and kills everyone with the wine you literally just said was poisoned[/spoiler]. Who should you bribe to end the war? Doesn't matter, your companion will [spoiler]murder the hostage and start the war back up immediately[/spoiler]. Dialogue option 1, 2, or 3? Doesn't matter, if you choose 1 or 2, Eivor will just say 3 afterwards anyway. There's five supposedly big choices that affect the end of the game Witcher 3-style, but the impact is basically just [spoiler]whether your brother likes you or not post-game[/spoiler]. I got this on sale, but it was way too monotonous and disappointing to play again.

I loved Assassin's Creed games in the past. But this will be the first Assassin's Creed game that I have played and not completely finished. Ubisoft outdid themselves this time and in a bad way. 

I am starting to believe that artists and location designers are the only people left at Ubisoft that still actually know how to do their stuff. Everything else feels raw, unfinished, boring or downright bad. I'll try to summarize the key points, starting with the things that are sort of done well:

1) Locations. AC has always been a visual "image of an era" and Valhalla is no exception. Nordic winter vistas, fjords, nithing cursed sites, decaying Roman ruins with straw huts around them, druid forests, frankish villages - they are all visually interesting to look at and take screenshots of. And this is probably the only thing that I really have no issues with.

2) Music. It's nice, with some quite memorable tracks, like Hrafnsmál - The Words Of The Raven. And it's an immense pain that in actual game the music has been MURDERED with compression. And actually that goes to the sound quality overall - everything is super quiet and compressed it makes you wonder what those 150GB that the game takes are actually for if they can't fit 30-40 songs in good quality in there.

3) Graphics. LOD quality leaves a lot to be desired and textures are weirdly inconsistent. For example, you can have a super detailed Eivor face right next to the 2005 texture quality level shirt that looks like it barely has normalmaps. Snow and snowy dirt barely have proper detail on them as well, especially in Norway. This makes for a very jarring experience when you can't stop noticing the badly done stuff. Again, what are 150GB of game size for if good textures aren't part of it, apparently?

TAA in Valhalla is absolutely atrocious, it murders every bit of detail unless you play at 4K or such. I had played at max settings at 1440p and my game was a blurry mess at native resolution. Valhalla can look decent... nice, even - especially in some cities or unique locations, BUT - you have to jump through some hoops to get it to look better. I had to force my resolution scale to 180% and enforce Nvidia Sharpening and Texture pop filters (5 and 10% respectively) to make it look better.

4) Story. It's alright, but feels a lot like an afterthought for an already selected location for the game. I can't shake this feeling even in DLCs and their respective stories. None of the characters are memorable, they flash through your eyes in a caleidoscope of territory pledge quests, about an hour screen time each maybe. When Ubisoft tries to do emotional moments in story, it just doesn't hit because you can't care less for them. If you wanted to roleplay tough viking that actually paints English shores red with blood, to reave and plunder properly - tough luck, you'll still get punished for killing monks and "civilians". And of course main and side stories are spoiled with quota NPCs like black vikings, gay Lunden reeves and so on and so forth. Beating a dead horse at this point but I had to mention it.

5) General gameplay, combat and gear/loot system. Everything I had loathed in Origins and Odyssey is even worse here. Don't believe anyone who told you this game is going to be shorter - it's far from that. At the time of writing this review I am 178 hours in and I still have Ireland, Asgard and multiple roguelite modes left to finish. Activities are littered across the map like cat poop. Every treasure chest, every stone cairn and fly agaric mushroom is now a simple puzzle, but they are repeated so many times it becomes annoying to an extreme. Parkour or physics based puzzles are especially frustrating because they are very clunky and buggy and controls have even worse responsiveness than Odyssey.

I expected at least decent quests and I am super disappointed. Outside of two dozen main-ish questlines, there are only "world events" that are super short, super simple and are often downright nonsensical and/or cringe. Yes, I am talking about a lady farting from consuming viper eggs in Ledecestre, for example. This is horrible and Ubisoft should be ashamed of even putting it in, it's not even a comedic relief.

Combat is a step up from Odyssey, in my opinion, but again, very buggy and woven with white threads - you will find your limbs and weapons awkwardly teleporting to your enemies more often than you'd like to see, which is pretty bad for a combat system that is trying to be flashy. Finisher animations are very few so you'll be forced to see the only one available per weapon again and again and again... and again. 

The game is also laughably easy on normal difficulty and frustratingly bad with HP bar sponge enemies at anything higher than normal. Abilities are literally useless and act as "press X to do slightly more damage". The only actually useful active ability is an explosive arrow to destroy weak walls and save yourself some time from searching for an oil jar.

Gear and builds - all collectable weapons are unique now, so no loot nightmare from Odyssey but that barely matters because of what I wrote above. You'll either smite everything away by simply looking at it at a normal difficulty or will waste 5 minutes per enemy chipping at him without any enjoyment. 

6) Technical state of the game. It crashes. A lot. No, A LOT. Usually it happens because the game calls some unexisting function in Ubisoft Connect launcher, can't find it and closes itself completely. Your mileage may vary, but Valhalla is super crashy, be warned. 

All that is spiced up with a traditional for Ubi at this point microtransaction store in a singleplayer game, XP and silver boosters and literal heaps of armor softlocked behind premium currency instead of being available as quest rewards or something. Plus the news about the new AC Mirage flying past Steam again reinforce me in my thought that supporting them was a bad decision and I should refrain from buying their products - it's indeed a product because I can't call it a game nor can I recommend anyone to waste time on it. 

Ubisoft is incapable to learn and improve, it seems. Don't buy this game.

Well hello this is my first review so be kind:) 
i will break down the game into a list of the things i find great with the game and the negatives of the game here we go!

positives (great things)
-if you like the Norse mythology lore and brutal combat there is no shying away from that here.
-combat is smooth ability's are similar if not close to the same layout as odyssey so i found it familiar and comfortable to get used to the control's in this ac quickly.
-story is what you would expect from a viking story line some of the characters are very remember able and off there rocker some are just bland but i will touch up on that later in the negatives. 
- your bird companion is helpful and not over powered like the origins and odyssey makes game a little more challenging in my opinion and enjoyed this version of the bird eagle raven etc call it what you will.
-customisation is very well done in this game tattoos ship cosmetics hair raven cosmetics so forth and so on for all weapons and armour as well.
- Mini game such as Orlog and flyting are extremely fun in this ac creed game and i hope they bring back more games similar to Orlog or flyting in future ac games.
-side quest in ac Valhalla or a mixture of bland OK and well done i would say the side quests here are slightly less on par with odyssey and better then origins how ever i may be bi-est as i am very much into viking lore and history and personally i would say i prefer Valhalla side quests over ac odyssey.
--Negatives 
oh boy here we go everyone's favourite  part :) now let us begin 
-- loading times seem to be longer then the other last 2 ac game that have came out.
-expansion was not nearly as fun as the expansion sets for ac origins and Odyssey i found them to be very bland and repetitive with the expansion of wrath of the druids.
--frame rate issues and screen tearing on older pc not sure about new machines but i have heard some issues as well.
-- main story can drag out and get repetitive.
-raiding is very repetitive and always the same goal.
Well that pretty much sums up my first review please comment and let me know any feed back or just to say good job thanks for reading and if this is well reviewed i may continue to review more in the future 
--cheers apothis09!

Digital Deluxe Upgrade


About the Game

Unleash your imagination and create a unique world of Sims that’s an expression of you. Download for free, and customize every detail from Sims to homes and much more. Choose how Sims look, act, and dress, then decide how they’ll live out each day. Design and build incredible homes for every family, then decorate with your favorite furnishings and décor. Travel to different neighborhoods where you can meet other Sims and learn about their lives. Discover beautiful locations with distinctive environments and go on spontaneous adventures. Manage the ups and downs of Sims’ everyday lives, and see what happens when you play out scenarios from your own real life. reviews.review: This game should be titled, "The DLC's 4".
Ruined my life :3!!!

Loved the game for about the first 10 hours or so but after discovering how the mechanics worked it just became a repetitive, barebones, game. I fell in love with Sims 2 back in the day but even that much older game felt like it had more “soul” than this empty husk of a game. 

Do I recommend it? Since it’s now free, sure. Why not check it out…but I will say that the fact that the base game is so shallow while a good deal of DLC is $30-$40 each doesn’t sit right with me. They even charge you $10 for the “privilege” of doing laundry. Take that as you may.

There are 21x £4.99 DLC packs that do NOT go on sale.
[h1][b] PRICE- £104.79 [/b][/h1]

There are 13x £34.99 DLC packs that DO go on sale for £17.49 each.
[h1][b] Full price - £454.87 OR Sale price - £227.37 [/b][/h1]

There are 12x £17.99 DLC packs that DO go on sale for £12.59 each.
[h1][b] Full price - £215.88 OR Sale price - £151.08 [/b][/h1]

There are 18x £8.99 DLC packs that DO go on sale for £6.29 each.
[h1][b] Full price - £161.82 OR Sale price - £113.22 [/b][/h1]

So in total if you buy all the DLC on sale it will cost you £627.15. If you buy all the DLC NOT on sale it will cost you £937.36.

EA has made The Sims 4 FREE TO PLAY and they have released 1 FREE DLC. I cannot recommend a game that has such a CASHGRAB scheme behind it. It does not help that most of the DLC's are absolute utter garbage. They have COUNTLESS bugs and problems with each DLC that breaks the game in some way, shape or form. EA do NOT care about the player at all when it comes to THE SIMS all they care about is lining their own pockets with our HARD EARNED CASH.

It was like the entire village i was in was changing along with the Sims I cared for. The Sims 4 is bland even with expansion packs. Believe me they will not fill the void left by the Sims 3. I have spent over 100+ dollars on some of the more higher rated packs and they really just don't fix the Sims 4 main problem, the Sims themselves. applist.name: God of War
applist.detailed_description:
Enter the Norse realm
His vengeance against the Gods of Olympus years behind him, Kratos now lives as a man in the realm of Norse Gods and monsters. It is in this harsh, unforgiving world that he must fight to survive… and teach his son to do the same.

Grasp a second chance
Kratos is a father again. As mentor and protector to Atreus, a son determined to earn his respect, he is forced to deal with and control the rage that has long defined him while out in a very dangerous world with his son.

Journey to a dark, elemental world of fearsome creatures
From the marble and columns of ornate Olympus to the gritty forests, mountains and caves of pre-Viking Norse lore, this is a distinctly new realm with its own pantheon of creatures, monsters and gods.

Engage in visceral, physical combat
With an over the shoulder camera that brings the player closer to the action than ever before, fights in God of War™ mirror the pantheon of Norse creatures Kratos will face: grand, gritty and grueling. A new main weapon and new abilities retain the defining spirit of the God of War series while presenting a vision of conflict that forges new ground in the genre.

PC FEATURES


High Fidelity Graphics
Striking visuals enhanced on PC. Enjoy true 4K resolution, on supported devices, [MU1] with unlocked framerates for peak performance. Dial in your settings via a wide range of graphical presets and options including higher resolution shadows, improved screen space reflections, the addition of GTAO and SSDO, and much more.

NVIDIA® DLSS and Reflex Support
Quality meets performance. Harness the AI power of NVIDIA Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS) to boost frame rates and generate beautiful, sharp images on select Nvidia GPUs. Utilize NVIDIA Reflex low latency technology allowing you to react quicker and hit harder combos with the responsive gameplay you crave on GeForce GPUs.

Controls Customization
Play your way. With support for the DUALSHOCK®4 and DUALSENSE® wireless controllers, a wide range of other gamepads, and fully customizable bindings for mouse and keyboard, you have the power to fine-tune every action to match your playstyle.

Ultra-wide Support
Immerse yourself like never before. Journey through the Norse realms taking in breathtaking vistas in panoramic widescreen. With 21:9 ultra-widescreen support, God of War™ presents a cinema quality experience that further expands the original seamless theatrical vision.

reviews.review: Kratos taught me so much more things than my actual father. 10/10
I shouldn't purchased and played the whole game, now my soul is strongly demanding a PS5 and God of War Ragnarök right now.

Do not be sorry. Be better.

Do not mistake my silence for lack of grief.

Anger can be a weapon. If you can control it, use it.

There are no "good" gods, boy. Thought I taught you that.

The road ahead is no place for a boy, you must be a warrior.

The gods care nothing for them. Men should not pray to monsters.

Keep your expectations low, boy, and you will never be disappointed.

Fate is another lie told by the gods. Nothing is written that cannot be unwritten.

Close your heart to their desperation. Close your heart to their suffering. Do not allow yourself to feel for them. They will not feel for you.
Second playthrough of this game now on pc and is still amazing. Release Ragnarok pls

I am definitely late to the party - this game has been out for a while now.. But I'll be damned if it doesn't hold up in every way possible! As a long time fan of the franchise, I've been waiting to see how things have changed.. And they have changed a lot (compared to GoW I, II & III). This game moves GoW from the classic "idk, I'm stronk, hack 'n slash everyone" to more of a "wait hang on, I need to take some time here" contemplative challenge. The challenges presented are the right level of difficulty to be truly rewarding when completed. 
I just have to say, as a final note... Go. W has always captured my heart in terms of the story telling aspect, and this instalment has given me the strongest emotional reaction that I've had playing through this franchise to date.
Somehow, you (Santa Monica Studios) have made me fall in love all over again. Mad props to literally EVERY SINGLE SOUL on the production team. 
Love it.

An AI definitely did not write the below review:

God of War is an absolute triumph in the world of video games. From the moment I picked up the controller, I was transported into an epic adventure unlike anything I had ever experienced. This game is a true masterpiece that raises the bar for storytelling, gameplay mechanics, and visual excellence.

First and foremost, the narrative in God of War is an awe-inspiring achievement. The game takes us on a journey with Kratos, the Spartan warrior, as he navigates the realms of Norse mythology alongside his son, Atreus. The father-son dynamic is beautifully crafted, and their evolving relationship adds a depth of emotion and vulnerability rarely seen in video games. The writing is impeccable, weaving a rich tapestry of tragedy, growth, and redemption that will keep you emotionally invested from start to finish.

The gameplay mechanics are flawless and finely tuned to perfection. Combat in God of War is intense, satisfying, and deeply strategic. Kratos wields his Leviathan Axe with unparalleled precision, while Atreus provides invaluable support with his archery skills. The seamless integration of cinematic moments into gameplay adds to the immersion, making every battle a breathtaking spectacle.

The world of God of War is a stunning work of art. The attention to detail in the environments, character designs, and mythical creatures is jaw-dropping. Exploring the realms of Norse mythology feels authentic and immersive, with each area offering unique challenges and secrets waiting to be discovered. The game seamlessly blends the epic scale of its world with intimate character-driven moments, creating a balanced and cohesive experience.

Furthermore, the musical score deserves special mention. The hauntingly beautiful compositions perfectly complement the narrative and evoke a wide range of emotions. The music swells with grandeur during epic battles, and delicately underscores the quieter, introspective moments, leaving a lasting impression on players.

God of War is a shining example of what video games can achieve as an art form. It pushes boundaries, challenges conventions, and raises the bar for storytelling and gameplay. With its breathtaking visuals, emotionally charged narrative, and meticulously crafted gameplay mechanics, it has set a new standard that will be remembered for years to come.

In conclusion, God of War is an absolute triumph. It delivers a captivating story, engaging gameplay, and a visually stunning world, all while exploring themes of family, sacrifice, and the consequences of one's actions. This game deserves every bit of praise it has received and more. It is a true testament to the power of video games as a medium, and an experience that no player should miss.

applist.name: Dead by Daylight
applist.detailed_description:
OVERVIEW


About the Game

Death Is Not an Escape.


Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed.

Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey.

The Survivors' goal in each encounter is to escape the Killing Ground without getting caught by the Killer - something that sounds easier than it is, especially when the environment changes every time you play.

More information about the game is available at http://www.deadbydaylight.com

Key Features

• Survive Together… Or Not - Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be selfish. Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone. Will you be able to outwit the Killer and escape their Killing Ground?

• Where Am I? - Each level is procedurally generated, so you’ll never know what to expect. Random spawn points mean you will never feel safe as the world and its danger change every time you play.

• A Feast for Killers - Dead by Daylight draws from all corners of the horror world. As a Killer you can play as anything from a powerful Slasher to terrifying paranormal entities. Familiarize yourself with your Killing Grounds and master each Killer’s unique power to be able to hunt, catch and sacrifice your victims.



• Deeper and Deeper - Each Killer and Survivor has their own deep progression system and plenty of unlockables that can be customized to fit your own personal strategy. Experience, skills and understanding of the environment are key to being able to hunt or outwit the Killer.

• Real People, Real Fear - The procedural levels and real human reactions to pure horror makes each game session an unexpected scenario. You will never be able to tell how it’s going to turn out. Ambience, music, and chilling environments combine into a terrifying experience. With enough time, you might even discover what’s hiding in the fog.


WARNING: PHOTOSENSITIVITY/EPILEPSY SEIZURES - READ THIS NOTICE BEFORE PLAYING

A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games. If you or any of your relatives has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing any video game.

IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult a physician if you or your child experience any of the following symptoms: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitching, involuntary movements, loss of awareness, disorientation, or convulsions. Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: sit farther from the screen, use a smaller screen, play in a well-lit room, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.

• Deeper and Deeper - Each Killer and Survivor has their own deep progression system and plenty of unlockables that can be customized to fit your own personal strategy. Experience, skills and understanding of the environment are key to being able to hunt or outwit the Killer.

• Real People, Real Fear - The procedural levels and real human reactions to pure horror makes each game session an unexpected scenario. You will never be able to tell how it’s going to turn out. Ambience, music, and chilling environments combine into a terrifying experience. With enough time, you might even discover what’s hiding in the fog.


WARNING: PHOTOSENSITIVITY/EPILEPSY SEIZURES - READ THIS NOTICE BEFORE PLAYING

A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games. If you or any of your relatives has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing any video game.

IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult a physician if you or your child experience any of the following symptoms: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitching, involuntary movements, loss of awareness, disorientation, or convulsions. Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: sit farther from the screen, use a smaller screen, play in a well-lit room, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.
applist.short_description: Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught and killed.

Am i joking ? Maybe. Maybe not. 

Ps. Achievements require buying all DLCs. Hope they will get rid of this.

PROS 
- Jogo tem bastante conteúdo todo ano e muito evento, então pra quem tem receio do jogo morrer, pode ficar tranquilo pois a Behaviour sempre atualiza ele.
- Cada killer tem uma abordagem de gameplay diferente, seja pelo poder ou pelas suas perks
- Muitas franquias de terror inclusas, como Myers, Freddy Krueger, Leatherface, Pyramid Head, Wesker e Nemesis.
- Boa parte dos cosméticos e os bonecos originais podem ser conseguidos apenas jogando, mas demora bastante.
- Jogar de Survivor com os amigos é muito divertido e até rende uns sustos, se você não está familiarizado com os mapas e killers do game

CONTRAS
- Sistema de pareamento de partidas é péssimo. Muitas vezes você vai cair em salas lagadas sem saber o por que
- Não sei por que a Behavior insiste no sistema de ranking pra um jogo casual. Isso faz com que muitas das partidas sejam frustrantes, PRINCIPALMENTE se você é main killer e tá aprendendo um boneco novo. Se você passa raiva fácil, fique longe da gameplay de Killer e só jogue de Survivor.
- Comunidade tóxica : Não é de hoje que esse jogo tem uma galera chata. Se você não joga como os survivors querem, se prepare pra ser xingado ou reportado por só ter campado quando já tava no End Game da partida.
- Jogar de Killer é frustração na certa, a menos que você só jogue com uns 2 ou 3 killers e domine eles. Mesmo assim, terá partidas que você será destruido e não há o que fazer. Infelizmente, a Behaviour não sabe balancear o sistema de ranqueamento (na real, nem devia existir tal sistema, a menos que tenha uma playlist competitiva) e o jogo no geral, com muitos perks de atraso de gerador sendo nerfados.
- Ausência de uma área unicamente competitiva, já que eles insistem em manter um sistema de rankeamento.

RESUMO

O jogo é divertido, tem muito conteúdo e da uma dose de terror quando você tá começando no game, fora que jogar com amigos é muito bom, mas também pode ser frustrante jogar contra alguém que já tem +2000h do jogo e tryharda de Killer, ou uma party fechada de 4 survs que focam no famoso GEN RUSH. Infelizmente, a Behaviour não sabe balancear o game, e usa um sistema de pareamento de partidas horrível, com salas lagadas ou desequilibradas. Querem manter o ranking ? Botem um modo competitivo pra isso e deixa quem não liga pra rank jogar numa boa

I've put a lot of hours into this game, and I've enjoyed most of them. Many of the most recent changes and balance passes were long overdue, and have improved the core gameplay significantly. So why am I not recommending this game? 

In its current state, Dead By Daylight is incredibly flawed and often frustrating.

The two most recent DLCs have introduced the Knight and the Skull Merchant (the latter is clearly a Predator license that fell through late in development). These killers suffer the same core problems, however - they are not fun to play as or against, and their powers encourage objective camping. As a result, I have barely wanted to play as these killers. My survivor matches against these killers tend to feel the same as well - the killer will choose 3 generators and only defend them for the entire match. This leads to overly long matches that aren't very fun for either side.

Aside from this, lack of map variety and the general same-y feeling that most maps have also kept the game stagnant. BHVR appears unwilling or incapable of creating any new gameplay modes, so the primary objectives are the same in every match.

There are an entirely ridiculous number of perks available to pick from. It's probably deterred a lot of people from getting into the game. I'd imagine that the large number of DLCs have also scared people off as well. Make the unlicensed DLCs free after a few years, please.

The community is terrible. Most survivors whine about how easy killer is, and it's obvious that the same survivors have never played killer due to their lack of understanding of killer's core mechanics/powers. Conversely, some killers play only to make other players miserable by hook camping.

There's plenty of good game here, beneath all of it. I would recommend this game to someone only if they are prepared to spend tens of hours learning the different ins and outs of all the perks and killers. Everyone else should stay far away, until we get some major changes.

Dead by Daylight is probably one of my favorite games of all time.

I just wrote a long post about how much I dislike this game TWICE. Honestly, it's just so disappointing that I don't even know what to say anymore.

Please don't buy this game if you're reading this. Save yourself.

applist.name: Lost Ark
applist.detailed_description:
Embark on an odyssey for the Lost Ark in a vast, vibrant world: explore new lands, seek out lost treasures, and test yourself in thrilling action combat. Define your fighting style with your class and advanced class, and customize your skills, weapons, and gear to bring your might to bear as you fight against hordes of enemies, colossal bosses, and dark forces seeking the power of the Ark in this action-packed free-to-play RPG.


Discover a World Brimming with Adventure
Explore seven vast, varied continents and the seas between them to find vibrant cultures, strange and fantastical beasts, and all the unexpected marvels waiting to be discovered. Delve into the secrets of Arkesia, prove your might in battles and raids, compete against other players in PvP, travel to distant islands in search of hidden riches, face packs of enemies and colossal bosses in the open world, and more.


Your Odyssey Awaits
Splash into massively satisfying ARPG-style combat and progression as you quest, raid, and fight on the scope of an MMO. Whether you want to play solo, in groups with friends, or matched up with other adventurers in the world, there’s an epic adventure waiting for you. Fight in the open world or delve into chaos dungeons, go head-to-head in expert PvP duels, test your mettle on epic quests, raid against bosses big and small, and hold your own in the fight against the Demon Legion to reclaim the power and light of the Lost Ark.


Define Your Fight
Lost Ark offers easy-to-learn features with unexpected depth and room for customization. Hit the ground running with pick-up-and-play action then take control of your combat with the unique Tripod system. Unlock three tiers of customization for each of your abilities, giving you powerful control of exactly how you fight. Lost Ark’s ever-expanding roster of iconic classes—each with their own distinct advanced classes—offers plenty of room to explore until you find the combat style that’s just right for you.

The same goes for other features: as you continue your journey, you’ll find non-combat skills, crafting, guilds and social systems, and other rich features that bring the world alive. Whether you want to skim along the surface or dive deep into the details is up to you.

I'll put this here just to filter my thoughts out. 
I do play (still unfortunately) since the initial release of the game.
Apologies upfront for any spelling mistakes I make in this text.

CONS:
1. This game is NOT casual/F2P friendly in any way possible even though it might act like it. 
- Yes, even though game does provide you with "a lot" of free stuff to progress your character/s, the overwhelming grind you have to do to actually achieve a "proper" endgame expirience overshadows all of it.
- If you hear that this game feels like "having a new job" sort of way, it is indeed true.
- For each one of these "problems" or lets say non casual friendly "mechanics" I am going to list here, I could make a separate paragraph how it corrupts the whole gameplay expirience:
Gatekeeping, FOMO, Absurd amount of toxicity especially in raids, RNG on casino level,... this is pretty much constant daily expirience for even most of veteran players till this date... 

2. Game design is corrupted to the core with INSANE amount of RNG systems to progress your character. 
- Do not get me wrong here... I like a lot of systems which provide you way to progress... however in this gamem every single one is pretty much full fledged casino expirience... it is RNG fiesta at this point.
- The only thing that has a so called "pity meter" where you are pretty much "garanted" a successful character progression in some period of a time is honing (enchanting your main set of gear).
- Every other character progression system is a predatory RNG system designed for you to spend some cash or spend that "new job" amount of time to be successful and achieve what you aim for. (Yes, MMOs are supposed to be grindy... that completely fine and that also part of why I like this genre... this game however takes this topic to a whole different lvl worth of paragraph itslef.)

3. Things I have already mentioned before such as: Gatekeeping, FOMO, Toxicity, RNG, are not an uncommon occurrence even in MMO genre. However, what I do have to say is that even after thousands of hours spent in different MMOs (and other generes), I had never expirienced these issues to have such a hard impact on the playerbase itself, the game is literaly repulsive to play after a while with all of that negative expirience.

PROS:
1. Great combat!
- The combat this game has is quite an expirience. Every single class does feel unique and well designed it its own way. Combat wise this game is pleasure to play.

2. Immerse endgame PVE expirience. 
- The whole part of raids, "legion raids", that this game offers at endgame is arguably one of the best in whole MMO genre.
- You have to learn certain mechanics to be successful, but its worth it. From cinematic point of view to music... that part is worth of some time to expirience it .

3. Somewhat decent graphics. The asymetric camera point of view is also quite well designed.

Summary:
With all things considered, I just can't and will not recommend this game to any new, casual or F2P player.
In my opinion, the game is great in its own ways with tremendous potential to grow and fix certain issues that players do provide as a feedback. However I do not see that hapenning in any near future or at all to be honest, since many changes that "community" feels like they should be implemented just do colide with that predatory game design they have.
The scale of changes that would have to happen in game to be fun for new players and also keep veteran players invested for longer seems to be to great to actually happen.
It would probably just lose AGS and Smilegates a lot of money generation they got implemented in the game systems and well... nobody likes losing money right?

This game has extremely fun content that I love playing, but this review will focus on the negative side of the game.

There are so many barriers to get to the fun content that new players will have an awful time getting there. The game has an account level system that is an accumulation of the experience from all of your characters combined. People will not accept you into groups if that level is not high enough. The developers are adding catch up mechanics and systems but they do not have any way to help players catch up with experience and an outdated card system in the game that takes months/years to complete due to random chance packs and is becoming a standard requirement in the late game making it hard on new players.

Don't let the single player tag fool you into thinking you can play this game completely solo because you will need to play with other players due to Legion Raids being a requirement to upgrade your gear to experience higher level content. There is plenty of solo content in the game, but that is not the most satisfying and well designed content the game has to offer.

There are outdated monetization systems in the game that people have vocalized their discontent about and the developers refuse to remove them. It is one of the main reasons why the majority of players quit the game and it's not something you will be able to avoid.

Even though the game has great content, I do not recommend this game to new players because of the amount of gate keeping new players experience from the community, and the reason the gate keeping exists is because of the amount of playtime that is required on all of your characters to earn gold and build up that account experience. If you only play one character, you won't have the account level that is acceptable when looking for a party. The global and Korean community has complained and provided solutions to this many times but the developers refuse to update this making this game feel like a tedious second job that you have to play daily for hours.

The core gameplay of Lost Ark is fantastic. The classes have unique power fantasies and are fun, and the legion raids are some of the most fun activities in any MMO I've played. Unfortunately, I can't recommend the game since it's bogged down by everything else.
The grind to get to endgame is terrible, repetitive, and boring.

How should I put this.... I both love and hate this game
after 4500 hours into the game, spent at least couple thousand dollars, I feel I know enough. I quit the game few months ago mostly due to the amount of time you need. 
They say most games are either pay-to-win or extremely time consuming to keep up with the rest of the community, this game actually requires both...

Pros-
-graphic is decent, characters are very pretty
-game play is nice, requires you to actually know what you are doing with your class/skills etc
-upgrading gear has a pity system so at least you know there is a "end" (even if it costly you tons of gold/material regardless)
-community --this is variable since i started the game since it came out, if you are new, likely it is difficult to keep up and you will likely get yelled at alot

Cons- (two major ones)
-EXTREMELY time consuming, let me tell you why: if you want to just focus on one character (like many other MMORPGS), this game is NOT for you. By having alts, they can contribute to income for resources/gold/material for you to hone. Each character have their own individual daily chaos dungeons/bosses, weekly raids/quests. Looking back, I spent somewhere between 6-8 hours a day playing this just to get daily/weeklies done on 6 characters, that is usually not maintainable for most people with a regular worklife
-RNG system / cost: just spending time doesn't really get you the stuff you need. game has alot of in-game purchases for cosmatics/packs that you kinda need to get cards/honing mats. The game does give out free stuff frequently, but if you want to do the raids as soon as they come out, those will not be nearly enough. So that means if you REALLY want to keep up, more often than not you will need to pay real money for in-game stuff, especially if you are not playing 6-8h+ per day on 6+ alts. 
-some of the raids are really unforgiving, this could be frustrating for alot of people since there is always that ONE person out of eight people that screws up that ONE mechanism and wipe the raid the 50th times at 3AM in the morning.... But this goes back to "you really need to know what you are doing", so it depends on who is reading this. 


Overall, I love the game, but for a REGULAR person, unless you are really casual and just want to do a daily quest/boss kill for fun here and there and don't really care much about anything else, then this game is NOT for you. You really need to be semi-hardcore PLUS willing to spend cash to stay on the front line when raids come out etc.
P2W shit KR game with really good combat.

even with 4500 hours played you will still get gate kept through lower end content. you will spend hours just looking for groups to play the game. Don't expect to ever make it to end game as a new player unless you are playing 20+ hours a day.
Why do people hype this game so much. its literally a mobile game, but a lil better and on pc...

Imagine running on legos for a mile, then at the end when the pain is all over, everyone you love is disappointed in you for running ONLY a mile on legos, as you sit there in toe curling pain, bleeding from your feet.

Lost Ark's combat mechanics are the standout feature in an otherwise disappointing experience.
The game is plagued by an overwhelming grind and an artificial progression system that hinders player enjoyment.
Repetitive tasks and arbitrary barriers only serve to make gameplay tedious and frustrating. Sadly, Lost Ark falls short of its potential, leaving players feeling unsatisfied and drained.

Fuck gatekeeping raids, even when you're overgeared for them.
Fuck daily grind. 2 chaos dungeons, 2 guardians, every day with every character... fuck that.
And last but not least... 
FUCK PHEONS. 
 - Imagine being forced to buy a currency (with blue crystals or real money) just to pay an absurd fee to send shit to your alts.
 - Imagine having to pay the same fee with the same stupid currency on the Auction House for every piece of gear (even worse, on gear which are heavily dependant on RNG just to be useful. E.g. to cut Stones and Bracelets)
 - AND NOW, IMAGINE HAVING TO DO ALL OF THAT ON EVERY FUCKING CHARACTER YOU WANT TO PLAY.

Just nah.

And also, blah blah blah, Bots bad. Regions and Servers slowly dying.

Again, nah.

Skip this game unless you're convinced to else where.  
It's possible to grind your way with very little money spent to end game, but the content now is extremely skill based and challenging.  No amount of money can be spent to also by pass the unforgiving complex 45 minutes of non stop mechanics at end game.  Completing these are required to continue progressing.  45 minutes is for a perfect no mistake run.   The game is guided 100% by Koreans who insist the game is only fun if you spend 40 hours and have perfect no mistake skills.  The studio is clear that the content will only become more difficult and unforgiving.  It's not fun, it's stressful and everyone is screaming at each other because you can lose a hours worth of work because of the mistake of one person.  This is the actual game and will not improve because Smilegate in Korea is making this game for Koreans, not for us.
Play this game if you want a second full time job where instead of getting paid, you pay your employer!

applist.name: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
applist.detailed_description:
Take part in an epic and ever-changing FINAL FANTASY as you adventure and explore with friends from around the world. This product also includes the entitlements to play FINAL FANTASY® XIV: A Realm Reborn and the expansion pack FINAL FANTASY® XIV: HEAVENSWARD.

For newcomers to FINAL FANTASY XIV Online, the Starter Edition includes two award-winning titles – FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn, and the first expansion, FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward.

Join over 25 million adventurers worldwide on an adventure that will take you to the heavens and beyond!

Includes 30-day free subscription period for all newly created service accounts*. User registration and service subscription are required to play the game.

* The 30-day free play period included with purchase can only be applied once to each platform on a single service account. Moreover, this 30-day free play period is not applicable to platforms on which a license has already been registered.

LOGO ILLUSTRATION: © 2010, 2014, 2016, 2018, 2021 YOSHITAKA AMANO

Note:
FINAL FANTASY XIV Online game packages available on Steam may only be registered and added on a Square Enix account that has the base game “FINAL FANTASY XIV Online Starter Edition" (or formerly known as "FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn”) purchased on Steam.

To view your 20 digit registration codes after purchase, simply right-click on “FINAL FANTASY XIV” in your Steam “Library” and select “View CD key” on the Steam client. The codes will always be accessible from this location should you ever need to reference them again.

The registration codes can be redeemed immediately on the Mog Station http://sqex.to/Msp. If this is your first time installing and registering "FINAL FANTASY XIV Online", you may redeem your registration codes during the initial installation process.

Please note that the Brazilian and Russian subscription and optional item prices were adjusted on November 15th, 2017. Please visit the following links for further details: Brazilian / Russian prices.

reviews.review: yeah it's alright
Met my wife on this game, now we are expecting and happily married. We play as two lalafells and do the savage raids.

Review in english/pt-br.
Análise em inglês/pt-br.

Did you know that the critically acclaimed MMORPG Final Fantasy XIV has a free trial, and includes the entirety of A Realm Reborn AND the award-winning Heavensward expansion up to level 60 with no restrictions on playtime? Sign up, and enjoy Eorzea today!

Jokes aside, it is critically acclaimed for a reason. This game really is what people say it is. All you gotta do is allow yourself to get immersed into this world, just like we used to do when we were kids playing our first MMO's.

The adventures, the time spent, the friends made along the way, the music, the art, everything. This game has a little thing for every kind of player and whenever you think you got the hang of it, you learn 10 new mechanics that challenge you in awesome ways and keep you engaged.

I never thought I'd have this much fun in an MMO after Maple Story and Archeage, but here I am, 1000 hours in and thirsting for more. Every new content release is a breath of fresh air and the community is simply the greatest I have ever met on the internet. Full of helping hands, curious people, new sprouts (as I once was!) and thrill seekers. Of course there are some bad folks here and there, but c'mon, nothing is perfect. XIV gets close, tho.

If you are reading this, it means I got your attention with the feelings, and my friend, you're in for quite the ride. Join this world and let yourself enjoy every second of it. Don't rush, don't skip stuff, don't pressure yourself. If you want it to be, it'll be a smooth ride, so ride along.

10/10. No doubt.

PT-BR:

Você sabia que o criticamente aclamado MMORPG Final Fantasy XIV tem uma Free Trial e inclui A Realm Reborn completo e a premiada expansão Heavensward até o nível 60, sem restrições de tempo de jogo? Inscreva-se e aproveite Eorzea hoje!

Brincadeiras à parte, é aclamado pela crítica por um motivo. Esse jogo é realmente o que as pessoas dizem que é. Tudo o que você precisa fazer é se permitir mergulhar neste mundo, assim como a gente costumava fazer quando era criança jogando nossos primeiros MMOs.

As aventuras, o tempo gasto, os amigos feitos pelo caminho, a música, a arte, tudo. Este jogo tem uma coisinha pra cada tipo de jogador e sempre que você acha que pegou o jeito, aprende 10 novas mecânicas que te desafiam de maneiras incríveis e o te deixam preso no jogo.

Nunca pensei que me divertiria tanto em um MMO depois de Maple Story e Archeage, mas cá estou, 1000 horas depois e sedento por mais. Cada patch novo é um sopro de ar fresco e a comunidade é simplesmente a melhor que já conheci na internet. Cheio de mãos amigas, pessoas curiosas, novos sprouts (como eu já fui!) e caçadores de emoções. Claro que tem gente ruim aqui e ali, mas vamo lá né, nada é perfeito. Mas FF chega perto.

Se você tá lendo isso, significa que chamei sua atenção com os sentimentos e, meu amigo, você tá prestes a pegar a montanha russa. Vem pra esse mundo e se permita aproveitar cada segundo dele. Não se apresse, não pule as coisas, não se pressione. Se você quiser, será um passeio tranquilo, então vamo embarcar nessa.

10/10. Sem dúvida.

Till the sea swallows all!

The game itself is incredibly fun: there is something for everyone. But for me it’s always been the people: I have made friends & enemies for life, and even seen plenty of irl relationships start within FFXIV. The amount of impact this game has had on my life cannot be understated. Yet I barely knew anything about MMO’s or Final Fantasy before this. Nearly any other game is just a fun way to pass the time for me, but this one will always feel like home.

Out of all video games I've played, this is my favorite video game ever. I've become very emotionally attached to the several characters and especially Emet-Selch. Heavensward, ShadowBringers, and Endwalker expansions was truly one of a kind experience, unforgettable moments.

As much as I believe that this is one of the best MMO titles on the market, I cannot recommend it. The subscription service model works games that are consistently getting free new content, but a game like FF14 that gets full 60$ expansions and still expects its playerbase to pay 12$ per month to play the game is not a healthy or consumer-friendly business model. If you do not have endless money to throw down the Square Enix hole, do not buy this game, you will be unable to play it after a month. There's a free trial that you can play to see if you like the game, but I don't recommend ever buying the full game, and especially not the DLC if you aren't absolutely sure that you'll end up playing the game. I cannot get a refund on the 80$ I've spent on this game in total despite now being unable to play the game for several years and I cannot play the free version because I've purchased the game. 

I DO like this game, it's just literally unplayable for me unless I spend an additional 12$ every month. Do not buy this as a new player, get the free trial and play that.

my worst experience and never ever gonna buy anything from Square Enix even  if its for free

By most metrics the best tab-target MMORPG on the market, but caveat emptor - this is a JRPG with an MMO included, rather than an MMO with the RPG mechanics just tacked-on. It cares about story, character, narrative setup and payoff, is remarkable both in terms of visual style and musical choices, and remains a remarkably earnest product in an otherwise very cynical market. Leave preconceived notions, cynicism and bitterness behind and give it a go honestly and with an open heart and you'll not be disappointed. Go into it with a suspicious and adversarial mindset and you might have a better time elsewhere.

While ARR isn't particularly special in terms of storyline and gameplay, virtually everything beyond that - including Heavensward which is a part of the free trial - steps up the quality immensely, leading to an unmissable experience. You owe it to yourself to go through the journey the game places in front of yourself. You will not leave it the same person you went in. I often find that there are two kinds of FFXIV players - ones who never made it past ARR, and the ones who preach the game's virtues from the rooftops like it's the second coming. 

Yes, it's an amazing game. Yes, you should play it. But it's also a pretty serious commitment. The reason why it isn't for everyone is because not everyone can give it the benefit of the doubt and not everyone can approach an earnest piece of media and let go of all the cynical and adversarial systems that recent gaming has seemed to cling to. 

If you do give it a go, it will reward you. You, the player. The human being who feels sorrow and joy, experiences suffering and triumph, goes through weal and woe. Leave as few barriers between yourself and the things it puts in front of you and you'll be well-treated.

Incidentally, this is just my playtime just since command-lining -issteam stopped working. I used to play it off steam for several years more.

applist.name: Warframe
applist.detailed_description:
New DLC Available


About the Game

Confront warring factions throughout a sprawling interplanetary system as you follow the guidance of the mysterious Lotus and level up your Warframe, build an Arsenal of destructive firepower, and realize your true potential across massive open worlds in this thrilling, genre-defining third-person combat experience.

BECOME A POWERFUL WARRIOR

Enter your Warframe: a bio-metal suit of untold power. Unleash its Abilities and wield a vast array of devastating weaponry to effortlessly annihilate hordes of enemies on sight. And when the slaughter is over, you can earn or instantly unlock 40+ different Warframes - each with a unique suite of powers - to re-experience the mayhem any way you want.

BATTLE ALONGSIDE FRIENDS

Form a Squad with your friends and earn valuable bonus Rewards when you complete Missions together via highly collaborative, co-op gameplay. Utilize your Warframe’s Abilities to heal allies, redirect enemy fire, and achieve your objectives. Stuck on a particular challenge? In-game matchmaking makes it easy to connect with friendly Tenno whenever you need an extra hand.

EXPLORE A MASSIVE SYSTEM

Deftly maneuver through ground-based Missions with your Warframe’s mesmerizing parkour skills, or take to the stars and engage in massive ship-to-ship battles in your very own customizable spacecraft. Lose yourself within mysterious open-world landscapes and discover a system teeming with fascinating lifeforms - both friendly and hostile.

DISCOVER AN EPIC STORY

Marvel at the sweeping history of the Origin System as you experience Warframe’s massive cinematic narrative spanning 5 separate expansions and 30+ story-based Quests. Discover the power within and experience your first taste of invincibility with one of three original Warframes before you begin your journey, develop your skills and seek out the truth behind your awakening.

MASTER YOUR ARSENAL

Your starter Weapons are just the beginning. Craft hundreds of destructive armaments, plus vehicles, Companions and more. Level them up and experiment until you find the right combination of gear that suits your unique playstyle. Fashion your weaponry for a fearsome look to compliment your custom-designed loadout.

CUSTOMIZE ENDLESSLY

Entering the Origin System means joining legions of friendly Tenno, each with their own personalized Warframes, Weapons and gear. With a staggering number of Customization options available to enhance your Loadout, designing the perfect look for your Warframe makes for an endlessly rewarding challenge for you and your Squad.
